Star Trek: Phoenix
Deck 2: Lower Bridge / conference-room
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 01:44 PM
He entered, sitting at the head of the table.
Cadet Edward Smith 29-Nov-19 01:45 PM
he sat down near the commander at the end of the table but kept the chair between them.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 01:46 PM
"Congratulations, Logan. You deserve it." He said with a smile. "We shall wait for the second person I summoned here, and then we shall begin our briefing."
Cadet Edward Smith 29-Nov-19 01:46 PM
"Thank you sir."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 29-Nov-19 01:55 PM
He walked in, glancing around
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 02:02 PM
"Have a seat, Commander." He invited. "We have something important to discuss."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 29-Nov-19 02:10 PM
He went and sat down.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 02:19 PM
"Alright." He said. "As you both know, we are short a Second and Third officer."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 29-Nov-19 02:21 PM
"We have Third Officers in Starfleet?" He questioned.
Cadet Edward Smith 29-Nov-19 02:22 PM
"We do. In the past I believe depending on circumstances went to a fourth or fifth." he mentioned matter of factly.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 02:23 PM
"Indeed. Which is why I summoned you both - we intend to appoint from one of you our next Second and Third officers."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 29-Nov-19 02:24 PM
He said nothing.
Cadet Edward Smith 29-Nov-19 02:26 PM
"Really. Then shouldn't our new CTO also be here?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 02:30 PM
"He'll be briefed separately - I'd like him to get used to the crew and ship first. But for all three of you, a test of command ability, devised by captain Talos and I, to be administered over the next few days."
Cadet Edward Smith 29-Nov-19 02:31 PM
"I see." thinking back to the last time he ran the kobayashi maru scenario (edited)
Ensign Alyx Morgan 29-Nov-19 02:32 PM
He said nothing still, even though his opinion of the idea was negative.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 02:36 PM
"Take it as a chance to show your stuff, as the humans say. Being the three most senior officers on board aside from myself and captain Talos, of course. We would both like to see each of you placed in our shoes - after all, there is no better place to hone your skills save the thunderdome itself..."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 29-Nov-19 02:36 PM
"If I may speak freely, sir."
Cadet Edward Smith 29-Nov-19 02:37 PM
he merely raised an eyebrow at the whole thing
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 02:38 PM
"Go on, commander. What's on your mind?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 29-Nov-19 02:39 PM
"I do not think we should be essentially competing for what is basically a promotion. For one thing, the new Chief Tactical Officer has only been here for a day." He commented.
Cadet Edward Smith 29-Nov-19 02:42 PM
"They still hold the same rank as us. And is equally eligable depending on their past experiences. I do accept the fact they are not accustomed to this crew yet as ample reason to not involve them." he mentioned. (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 02:44 PM
"Your objections will be taken into account." He replied. "For now, prepare yourselves - we begin our assessments over the next few days."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 29-Nov-19 02:45 PM
"You fail to take into consideration, sir, that if I was not already prepared, I should not be in Starfleet." He said plainly
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 02:46 PM
"We'd like to see commanders O'Hannon and Giovanni prove themselves as well."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 29-Nov-19 02:48 PM
"The fact of the matter is I have already 'proven' myself, and I still disagree with competing."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 02:50 PM
"You have, but they have not. End of discussion, Commander. You will have to compete with them for the position. It is only fair."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 29-Nov-19 02:51 PM
"I do not wish to compete." He said, standing up. "I shall not preform for a position that is supposed to be earnt." (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 02:55 PM
"If you wish. All we want is to test your individual abilities and make a judgment based on thus. We have seen you perform; but for all we know, Conmander O'Hannon might prove to be better than you." He stated. "The winner earns the post."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 29-Nov-19 02:58 PM
"I shall no take part in this when you are essentially turning Starfleet into a sport. What happened to earning positions? Because all you are doing is making us compete as if we were partaking in a triathlon. One small 'competition' does not determine an individuals' skill level over the course of their career. You cannot prove ability by temporarily putting an individual under pressure, because they will be prepared for that. You have to burn them out until they are struggling before you can determine their ability to command."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 02:59 PM
"Duly noted. Dismissed." He stated flatly.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 29-Nov-19 02:59 PM
He immediately walked out, not even bowing his head for once.
Cadet Edward Smith 29-Nov-19 03:04 PM
he blinked a couple times at the argument unsure if this was in his head now or had occured before him. "Well... I hope to not dissappoint. Is there anything else you wish to discuss? Or just open positions needed filling."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 03:04 PM
"That'll be all, unless the topic of your pets counts." He replied. "I could use some myself. A canine, perhaps."
Cadet Edward Smith 29-Nov-19 03:08 PM
"I only have Oscar Fish Commander. But they do kinda act like a dog, or at least share behavioral characteristics." he informed. "If you are interested in them. I could help you with that."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 03:09 PM
"We shall see. I already have ensign 21's child to care for once they've been brought into the world."
Cadet Edward Smith 29-Nov-19 03:11 PM
"So 21 has chosen god parents I guess?" he said to himself mostly "Well Oscars aren't hard to care for at least. Just remembering to keep the feeder full and the filters clean." (edited)
"Another thing. Minor modifications will be being made to the EPS grid on decks five, six and seven today. To improve efficiency of energy transfer between auxilary and primary systems. May cause minor disruptions but they will be temporary." he added.
"Should take two hours maximum."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 03:18 PM
"Good. Instruct your team to get started, please, we depart for the Sybillan Expanse once every crew member on Risa has returned home."
Cadet Edward Smith 29-Nov-19 03:19 PM
"Very well." he replied before dismissing himself
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Nov-19 03:49 PM
He walked out of the conference room himself
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 18-Dec-19 08:55 PM
He stepped into the conference room and sat down at the table. Even now his legalist mind eas still puzzling over why Zanmar had allowed Capri to dress in such... informal... attire while working on the bridge. Try that in the Guard and you'd be thrown in the brig without question. He simply couldn't bend his mind round it - it was simply illogical to him, and he questioned it with nary a shred of doubt in his mind. Surely even the Federation did not allow such breaches of dress code.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 09:04 PM
He walked in and closed the door without saying anything.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Dec-19 09:05 PM
[Kirhal]The Benthan stood up, regarding the much shorter Alexdon officer in front of him. "Permission to speak freely, sir?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 09:06 PM
“Granted.” He said plainly.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Dec-19 09:08 PM
[Kirhal]"Regarding the communications and intelligence officers. Is the standard of communication on this ship backchat to or arguing with senior officers as and when the person wants?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 09:09 PM
“Not normally, no.”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Dec-19 09:10 PM
[Kirhal]"Not normally? So why is this occasion in particular so special that it's warranted?" The Benthan's voice was rising slightly in volume - clearly, this was something that he was very, very unused to, and thus found alien... if anything. (edited)
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 09:12 PM
“I have no idea, honestly. Intel always seem to think they are higher than us.”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Dec-19 09:12 PM
[Kirhal]"So why haven't they been dealt with? If this is the standard of communication between junior and senior officers, then clearly something needs to be corrected."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 09:13 PM
“The Commander is going to deal with Davis.”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Dec-19 09:15 PM
[Kirhal]"Fine..." He paced around the room, clearly uncomfortable. "And what about the... er, hybrid? What excuse has he to report to duty looking like he's just rolled out of bed?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 09:15 PM
“We called him up in a life and death situation, and he sacrificed his personal time to assist us.”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Dec-19 09:18 PM
[Kirhal]"Alright then... I assume the same goes for the intelligence officer, then? If you noticed, she looked completely unkempt - hair undone, face like she'd just come back from the dead, uniform and rank insignia out of place. I'd quote regulation back to you, but of course, you know them well."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 09:22 PM
He nodded. “I noticed that, yes. I will bring it up with Commander Dunamis.”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Dec-19 09:24 PM
[Kirhal]"Thank you..." He sat back down, grunting in frustration. "Again, if I may be blunt. I am genuinely concerned if this practice of allowing disrespectful backchat and... wardrobe malfunctions... is standard practice aboard this ship. The Benthan Guard would never have allowed any of this."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 09:28 PM
“It needs fixing, I agree.” He stated plainly.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Dec-19 09:29 PM
[Kirhal]"Then with all due respect, sir, why has nothing been done? Why is this still standard practice!?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 09:30 PM
“If we are talking freely...” He said as he got himself a chair and sat down. “A lot of shit has happened lately. Too much quite frankly. The crew are all over the place so we avoid pissing them off with minor details.”
3
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Dec-19 09:34 PM
[Kirhal]"Then what this crew needs is discipline! Rules to keep them in line, lest all hell break loose!" The Benthan let his smouldering gaze rest on Genir, hazel brown eyes burning with fury. "If they need to be policed like juveniles, so be it! Sir, I see not Starfleet officers, or crew for that matter, but spoiled children in those two. I wasn't deaf to your little... argument, if you can call it that. They're in no position to talk back to you, and yet they did."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 09:37 PM
“I am aware, Lieutenant. But right now someone they care about has been in trouble and for that matter threatening to blow us up for the past.... three hours now? Of course they will have short tempers.”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Dec-19 09:41 PM
[Kirhal]"Rules exist for a reason, sir. Protocols exist for a reason. To keep order. Tell me, two crew members let their tempers rule their thoughts and words. Two will become four. Four becomes eight. Eight becomes... you get the idea. How many will it take before it becomes unacceptable?!" He slammed his fist on the table, clearly finding it very difficult to process the sheer difference in conduct. "Temper or no temper, you keep it in check when on duty. Air your concerns in private. Isn't that what Starfleet does?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 09:43 PM
“Sixteen.” He said plainly. (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Dec-19 09:45 PM
[Kirhal]"Sixteen what? Sixteen crew members that freely loose their temper in front of six bridge officers until it spreads like wildfire and cannot be contained!?" (edited)
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 09:45 PM
“You ironically remind me of myself when I first joined.”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Dec-19 09:46 PM
[Kirhal]"How does that relate to their lack of discipline, sir? I don't understand."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 09:48 PM
“Sometimes you have to take a step back and realise that they are still people. I have agreed with everything you have said, what more do you want me to do at this precise moment?”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Dec-19 09:53 PM
[Kirhal]"I just wanted information, sir. I am appeased that there is a reason behind their blatant breaches of written protocol, at least." He proceeded to hold his head in his hands. "As for the latter thing? People, yes. People that must bear in mind that for whatever they do, comes consequence. Let that slip, and, as the humans say, God protect us all. That's all, sir."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 09:55 PM
“You will learn to find a balance. As it is, I am still learning.”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Dec-19 09:57 PM
[Kirhal]"What balance? We keep the peace, sir, we're not supposed to care about what people think of us when we do our jobs. What's important, at the end of it all, is that this ship and everyone else on it is safe and in one piece."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Dec-19 10:29 PM
“Safe and in one piece. Got it in one, Lieutenant. Since when does our uniforms not being 100% affect that?”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 19-Dec-19 01:59 AM
[Kirhal]"So you imply that it is acceptable to not look the part while doing it?" He sighed and stood up, straightening his uniform back to its immaculate state. "I'm sorry for taking your time, Commander, I understand that you have a mission ahead of you. I shall return to duty on the bridge." He saluted Gen once, and stepped out of the conference room.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 11:03 AM
He sighed and sat there for a bit, thinking, before eventually getting up and leaving, but not before putting the chair back. (edited)
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 01:07 PM
He walked in and sat down at the end of the table, waiting.

He stood up. "Shall we get straight to the point? I think that would be a good idea." He said, walking over to her slowly, talking as he did. "Your attitude has been terrible, your manners non-existent, and you backchat like you would win a prize for doing so."
ob2lander961 19-Dec-19 01:24 PM
"So, you woke me up just to tell me that I am being mean to you? Great...Is there something you particularly wanted or can I get back to my quarters" (edited)
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 01:27 PM
He clicked his fingers loudly, but kept his hand by his side. "You will not talk back to me. Is that understood, Lieutenant Junior Grade?" He stated firmly. The light-heartedness he expressed on the bridge had completely gone.
ob2lander961 19-Dec-19 01:30 PM
"No, in fact I don't understand. I don't understand why you can't just leave me alone, I don't understand why I am hear, and I don't understand why you have some personal vendetta against me." She seemed fed up
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 01:31 PM
"I am beyond frustrated by your lack of respect, especially to your superior officers. You talk back to us like you have the authority to do so. Well, news flash, Lieutenant Junior Grade, you. Do. Not. We are not your friends, we are your superior officers. You treat us with respect, you do not backchat, and you do not argue with us. Do I make myself clear?" He said, sounding angry, but actually his voice remaining surprisingly calm. He hadn't even raised his voice. (edited)
ob2lander961 19-Dec-19 01:35 PM

Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 01:45 PM

ob2lander961 19-Dec-19 01:48 PM

ob2lander961 19-Dec-19 01:49 PM

2
ob2lander961 19-Dec-19 01:51 PM

Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 01:53 PM
He immediately forced her onto the ground face-first with minimal effort, grabbing both of her arms in the process to restrain her, and put a knee across her legs. "You are under arrest for threatening a Starfleet officer and insubordination. Do not try to resist, you will only tire yourself out, but you should know that considering how much information Intelligence has on my people." He said bluntly. Even if Davis tried to resist, she really couldn't do much because of the strength difference between the two. (edited)

Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 02:48 PM
He immediately tapped his commbadge. "Security detail to sickbay. Davis has been arrested. Monitor. When she is fit to leave, take her to the brig." He stated
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 19-Dec-19 02:49 PM
"Now. Brief me on what happened here, please."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 02:54 PM
"I brought her in for talks to do with her insubordinate attitude towards her senior officers. Specifically, the bridge incident. She continued to talk back to me, so I relieved her of duty pending an investigation into why she has said attitude and thinks she can talk back to us. She started to walk off stating that I could not, and I stopped her from going forward via grabbing her shoulder non-forcefully and stating I was the second officer. She threatened to break my arm so I took her down out of fear she would do so in order to arrest her for threatening me, and insubordination. During my attempt to restrain her, she also attempted to headbutt me. I called for help, at which point you all arrived and Soval attempted to separate me and my officer from the person I was trying to restrain. She continued to be a physical threat, moreso now there were more people in the room, so I ordered her to be stunned for the safety of everyone else and herself considering that a non-security officer was now trying to get involved which could ultimately hurt her." He stated plainly, before sighing
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 19-Dec-19 02:56 PM
"Why didn't you first ask her why she was acting this way? Don't you think that you should ascertain that of her first before making any further judgment?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 02:57 PM
"My job is not to be her friend. My job is to assert order on those who are insubordinate, among other things. I saw no reason for her to be acting the way she did, and even if she had a reason, there is still no excuse."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 19-Dec-19 03:01 PM
"Your job as second officer is also to empathize with the crew. To lead them by example. Recognize that there is sometimes deeper reason to why people act the way they do." He sat down at one of the conference room chairs, holstering his hand phaser with a sigh. "I do not condone what she has done, certainly. But I do not condone either your actions against her." (edited)
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 03:02 PM
"I felt threatened. I... think my old training took over, which was wrong. But, I still felt threatened."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 19-Dec-19 03:05 PM
"So did she. Do you not see that also? You placed her under threat of harm as well by grabbing her. She acted under reasonable fear of being harmed by you, knowing that you are quite capable of doing so."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 03:06 PM
"Once we have secured Giles you can relieve me of duty." He said blandly, having no way to argue the truth.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 19-Dec-19 03:11 PM
"There is no we, Commander." He stated just as flatly. "You will not go. If this incident is any indication, I worry for her safety - and quite frankly, yours as well - if the two of you are to clash during the mission. I will find another officer to replace you."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 03:12 PM
Anger slowly covered his face. "Fine. You can go being as you are such a good first officer. It would make a change for you to actually do something productive." He grunted, before straightening his uniform.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 19-Dec-19 03:16 PM
"Very well." His gaze never shifted from Genir's face. "Lieutenant-Commander Genir'maz Zanmar. I hereby relieve you of duty from this point forward. You are to appoint from your staff a suitable replacement for yourself as chief of security. Commander O'Hannon will fill your shoes as second officer until we decide what else is to come for you."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 03:17 PM
"I appoint Lieutenant Tarna'motlan and no one else. He is the only individual I see fit for the role."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 19-Dec-19 03:18 PM
"Not even your new officer?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 03:20 PM
"No. He is like me when I first joined. Brash, does not bend the rules. Does not sympathise. He reminds me of myself, even now. He is not good for being in command at this time, he will be worse than I have been." He said brutally honestly. "They deserve better. Someone who cares, who knows how to care."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 19-Dec-19 03:22 PM
"Good. I am glad that you see it. Return to your quarters and remain there until otherwise instructed."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 03:24 PM
"I request permission to go to the holodeck. I need to do something for the sake of my own health." He requested genuinely. There was not a shred of tone to make Dunamis doubt his intentions being genuine.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 19-Dec-19 03:25 PM
"That something being what, exactly?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 03:32 PM
"Play an instrument." He said plainly, as he upholstered his phaser and put it on the table, making sure to not aim it at Dune in the process.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 19-Dec-19 03:37 PM
For a brief few seconds, he scanned Zanmar visually; noting his demeanor and tone of voice, neither of which suggested hostile intention. "Granted." He replied.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 03:38 PM
"Thank you. May I speak to you as a person?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 19-Dec-19 03:40 PM
"Regarding what matter?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 03:40 PM
"Davis."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 19-Dec-19 03:41 PM
"What about her?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-19 03:41 PM

The Captain walked in about five minutes after Dunamis had left. "Good morning, officers," she immediately stated to the two assembled in the room. Taking her reading glasses from the collar of her jacket - they seemed to permanently be kept safe there - she picked up the PADD to read over the report. Would either of you two like to explain things further? I won't keep you here much longer, don't worry... `Ensign` Nyl BOT 25-Jan-20 03:03 PM
"So! Hello, everyone. I'm... I'm sorry that I've caused you so much trouble. And I'm sorry that you all had to get involved in this mess that I caused for my people. So right now... I need to undo what I started... and I need your help to do it."
"I need people to go with me... if you'd be willing to do this for me, of course. I need to shut down this crystal tower planetside; stop the signal being broadcast from it. It'll free my people from being happy all the time - no worse prison than a prison of eternal bliss, I've learned." His gaze fell to the floor, seeming almost sad.
Captain Syrezeaju 25-Jan-20 03:08 PM
Altering the structure of a society wasn't something that they should get involved in - it wasn't Starfleet's job. It should be done diplomatically, politically; through a vote by the people or something of the sorts. Did they know the truth? Were they aware of this signal? Had they consented to it? Were- so many questions, and she was trying to stay out of it...
jshoey18 25-Jan-20 03:09 PM
“How do you know so much about this signal?”
`Ensign` Nyl BOT 25-Jan-20 03:13 PM
"I built it." He said simply. "I thought at the time that it'd be a good idea. You see, my people are rather prone to fighting otherwise - always disagreeing, full of animosity. So many wars. So me and a team of my brightest scientists, and some of our wisest, most powerful religious leaders came together - no more fighting, no more war, we decided. It was time for it to end. So we... we built that monstrosity down on the planet. Signals broadcast throughout the planet; our crystals don't just hold a great amount of energy, they amplify it, too. Send that energy out in waves to the locals - it'd be so quiet that they'd never cotton on..." He began to sob, and cried into his arm like a scared child.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 25-Jan-20 03:15 PM
Maggie listened to the man. Speaking of what had happened..that sounded like one big mistake...one they would have to clean up...she didn’t mind of course, helping others was their speciality

The truth could come to some sort of referendum on the matter, or civil war, a coup... Anything. That was a delicate situation and Starfleet really shouldn't be interfering. Were these people even warp capable? The Prime Directive... There were so many issues with this. (edited)
`Ensign` Nyl BOT 25-Jan-20 03:19 PM
"No one's aware. They'd never consent otherwise - it'd lead to more fighting. We didn't want that. So we activated it on the night of our last war, when all the soldiers were asleep in their camps. The next day, it was like magic. No fighting. No weapons... it was bliss. Everywhere you looked, you saw people getting along! Happy! Shaking hands, smiling, hugging! Who wouldn't want that? A perfect society, no fighting, no arguments, no... no... xenophobia, is that what you call it? Everyone's friends..."

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 14-Mar-20 04:51 AM
"What about the encounter?" His grip tightened on the back of his chair - though he'd slept a good few hours, the encounter was still engraved into the forefront of his thoughts.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 14-Mar-20 04:54 AM
“When removing the bricks, we encountered a Romulan LCARS Console, and on it was information on their ship as well as other vital information. The most important one I noticed was the fact that there was a possibility to beam onto the Tal Shiar ship. Do you think you can pull up that information so we can get a better look at it sir?” She said, twiddling her fingers faster, and tapping her foot. She was eager to talk about this.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 14-Mar-20 04:56 AM
He walked up to the wall display and tapped at it, bringing up the information he'd extracted from the console and studying it.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 14-Mar-20 04:57 AM
Jayne studied it as well. "Pull up the information on that transportation sequence if you could." (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 14-Mar-20 05:02 AM
He swiped through the information on screen, bringing up the transport protocols... apparently leading up to a ship cloaked somewhere in orbit of New Romulus. The I.R.S. Arrinthe. "Interesting..." He muttered, attempting to access more information on the vessel.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 14-Mar-20 05:06 AM
"Is there any way that we can use this to our advantage Captain. use this." She pointed to the protocols. "To aid us in our efforts. If this ship is in orbit on New Romulus, then we need to contact the senate. It could also explain how they got here without us knowing that their ship was present."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 14-Mar-20 05:13 AM
"We could. The Senate must have this information - though I do not know how well they will respond to it, given their situation on the ground. Their available ships might be away fighting the Tal Shiar on other fronts." He swiped through the data, bringing up the ship's specs. He grimaced at the sight - it looked downright evil, with an abundance of forward-sweeping curved spikes... and bits of it glowed ominous green in some places.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 14-Mar-20 05:16 AM
"Is it possible, with this, given information, to transport onto the vessel, using the console found in the alley way?" She paused for a moment. "As well as there must be tracking systems close to the area where the console was. How would Valdain know of our presence so quickly?" (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 14-Mar-20 05:18 AM
"Who knows, Ensign? Who knows? The Tal Shiar certainly have their ways. And to transport onto the vessel... I do not know for certain. Perhaps it would require the Admiral's authorization codes or something similar. Are you planning to board the vessel and attack the Tal Shiar directly?"
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 14-Mar-20 05:22 AM
"Doing that sir, would be a death wish. In my honest opinion, if there were a way, I would gather an away team to board the vessel and disable it from the inside, giving us the slight advantage. I'd rather stay alive, then end up dead for doing something stupid. Their weapons are capable of frying my mobile emitter in 5 precise shots. But for every shot my emitter takes.... if my calculations are correct.... I can take down 2-3 Tal Shiar, before taking another hit. The others..... might not be the same. I suggest we plan this thoroughly if we are going to pull something like that off. And with your authorization, I would like Engineering to be heavily involved with the plans. But all of this will not happen, until we are sure that what we are doing, can be possible." (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 14-Mar-20 05:24 AM
"And those plans are best made while we are not emotional and more rational minded. The crew deserves their time to mourn, and so do you and I. I'm afraid that, in our current mental states, I fear that we will allow our emotions rather than our thinking to rule our judgment. Any operation of the sort will have to wait."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 14-Mar-20 05:26 AM
"I completely agree with you captain. I just like to keep you in the know of what I suggest to be planned. so that I don't catch you off guard at the last moment."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 14-Mar-20 05:28 AM
"Of course. Now, please. I do urge you to accept the half shift offer I made to the crew. I believe that it will do all of us some good. Meet with your friends, talk to them. Put the thought of this and our aid efforts on New Romulus aside for the duration."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 14-Mar-20 05:30 AM
"Thank you captain, I will accept the offer. But for now, my duties are currently on the bridge. Best wishes to you, sir." She stuck her hand out for a handshake.

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 02:45 PM

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 16-Mar-20 02:51 PM

Commander Blanche Carlisle 16-Mar-20 03:40 PM
Blanche had eventually followed Dunamis into the conference room, seating herself perpendicular to the Captain at the head of the table, legs folded neatly.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 16-Mar-20 03:40 PM
[Capri] He straightened up when Blanche entered, his gaze hardening a little.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 16-Mar-20 03:43 PM
The doctor’s expression was somewhat unreadable, her gaze drifting between the two intelligence officers, and then back to the Kelpien. She merely nodded in acknowledgement of the former two, remaining otherwise silent.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 03:46 PM
"Thank you both for coming." He told both of them, expression grim. "We have information to give you. Information regarding commodore Khassid's death - and the person who orchestrated it. This information must be kept to only you and the senior staff, and no one else besides your superiors at Starfleet Intelligence. Is that understood?"
Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 03:49 PM
"Understood, sir." Oskar said. He already knew about Khassid's medical records. Maybe they could shed some insight into the perpetrator responsible.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 03:50 PM
He looked sideways at Blanche, grip tightening on the side of the table. "Doctor? If you'd like to start us off?"
Commander Blanche Carlisle 16-Mar-20 03:57 PM
“Of course,” Carlisle had cleared her throat, a poor attempt to break the uncomfortable silence that had swamped the small gathering. With one delicate motion, she’d brought up those notorious cell exams to be displayed by the table’s holo-emitter, the resulting image bathing the officers in a steady glow. “Here are scans taken from the Commodore throughout her treatment, analysin’ cell abnormalities we thought to be a product of the cancer.”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 03:59 PM
He waited for her to continue- this was for her to explain; he had little knowledge of the medical theory underlying.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 04:00 PM
Oskar paid attention to the Doctor. This was something that he didn't know, so he let her continue talking. This was a most interesting case.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 16-Mar-20 04:13 PM
“This,” the image minimised, making room for another analyses that was almost identical in comparison. They appeared side by side, striking similarities singled out by the strings of accompanying verbal data. Blanche grimaced at the juxtaposition: every time she’d looked at the results, the doctor felt unspeakable resentment. “This is a cellular sample from the Realto, a species who were suddenly overcome with a unique plague after years of it lyin’ dormant. Not only did such dormancy line up with the Commodore’s advancin’ cancer, but her condition was worsenin’ far beyond what was typical for the type. Doctor Clark also noted that there were inconsistencies in her initial diagnosis; at her age, development of this certain cancer is practically unheard of.” It was then that Blanche looked up briefly, as if to check that the officers were following. (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 04:18 PM
Oskar was listening intently. "So how did the Commodore come into contact with this plague that afflicted the Realto?" Oskar asked Carlisle.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 04:20 PM
"She was infected with it by her husband." He said grimly, looking to Blanche to see if he was right. "One lieutenant-commander Dennzen Zoyill. A science officer like she used to be. The two were former laboratory partners turned life partners... but alas, as you know, things went horribly wrong."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 04:22 PM
"So she was infected with the plague. By the husband. I assume once he poisoned her, he skipped town. Hasn't been seen since?" Oskar asked the two of them. "Also, how did he get his hands on this plague?"
Commander Blanche Carlisle 16-Mar-20 04:27 PM
Blanche’s eyes dropped to the ground. The last time she had to verbally recount this was to Dunamis himself, with Khassid beside her. Even here, even now, she could so vividly picture the pain deep within the Cardassian’s every movement as she was transported back to such a heinously personal violation. “The Commodore’s husband was the lead cellular biologist tasked with curin’ the plague. He developed an obsession with the workin’s of the disease, comin’ to view it as a potential biological weapon capable of immense devastation.”
Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 04:29 PM
"A plague that can lie dormant for years and never be detected? I'd sure call that a weapon. Did they ever find a cure or a vaccine for this plague?" Oskar asked her. This was almost sickening.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 04:32 PM
"Apparently not - doctor, do correct me if I am incorrect in so saying...?"
Commander Blanche Carlisle 16-Mar-20 04:53 PM
“Well, that’s just the thing, Schneider.” Blanche had since returned her gaze to the group, grimly resolute. “The original plague responded to targeted chemical treatment, although Zoyill’s developments and the Commodore’s complications rendered the typical approaches ineffective, some detrimental.” Pausing, Carlisle’s brows furrowed. “If there’s any chance of there bein’ a ‘true’ cure out there, it lies with none other than our perpetrator. Even if we were unable to pursue this lead in time to help the Commodore, it’s highly unlikely that there aren’t others out there who’ve fallen victim to his senseless cruelty. There’s no tellin’ the devastation this man has wreaked; I fear the conspired murder of an esteemed flag officer might just be the tip of the iceberg.”
Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 05:05 PM
"Done have a current lead on him or someone who works for him?" Oskar asked while looking at Carlisle and Dunamis.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 05:07 PM
"He is a science officer aboard the USS Tiersen, but is currently away on shore leave. I will be contacting his commanding officer in order to ascertain the location of his shore leave if I can, as well as to obtain more related information about him. As for any possible accomplices... none, I'm afraid."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 05:10 PM
"So, the Commodore is patient 0 for this plague that infected the Realto. The Commodore is killed and the virus is perfected. So then what or who is his next target?" Oskar asked, pacing back and forth.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 16-Mar-20 05:20 PM
“We have no idea, just as we’re uncertain that the Commodore is the only one who’s suffered at his hands. Quite frankly, it appears as though Zoyill had quite the solid grasp on the biology for some time; the initial violation transpired back when the Commodore was still married, accountin’ for the cellular dormancy. Furthermore, she herself expressed fear that he may have potentially brought harm upon others between then and now, meanin’ we have no clue of the potential damage dealt.”
Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 05:23 PM
"We need to find him, then. When he put in his shoe leave request, did he specify where he was going? Maybe a system or planet?" Oskar asked them. "We should try to track him down. Start from the moment he left the ship."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 16-Mar-20 05:24 PM

Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 05:30 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 05:34 PM

Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 05:35 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 05:37 PM

Commander Blanche Carlisle 16-Mar-20 05:43 PM

Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 05:47 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 05:56 PM
"We will cross that bridge when we come to it. For now we'd like the two of you to do your utmost to obtain what little information you can on him, most notably travel patterns - see if there is a pattern to his movements. Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 05:59 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 06:07 PM

Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 06:08 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 06:22 PM

Commander Blanche Carlisle 16-Mar-20 06:39 PM

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 16-Mar-20 06:57 PM
[Capri] "Hang on a second. We are not letting Oskar do this on his own. In case you two weren't aware, hes only been an intel officer for like....five minutes. And he's already screwed up once with this lone wolf shit." He paused and shook his hair from his eyes, "I'm not letting him take another step into this mission without my supervision. Especially since both him and a certain CMO thought it would be real cute if they played James Bond and tried to go over the head of super senior officer."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 06:59 PM
"Oh, Christ." Oskar said to himself, pinching the bridge of his nose. He sighed deeply and looked at Capri with a death glare. Way to oust a man in front of both his Captain and CMO. He couldn't wait to hear the next part of this conversation.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 16-Mar-20 07:00 PM

Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 07:03 PM

Did it not occur to you that you should speak to the senior intel officer first?"
Commander Blanche Carlisle 16-Mar-20 07:10 PM
“With all due respect, Ensign Schneider approached me with suspicions. I’d like to think he’d support me when I say I didn’t explicitly share any information, nor did I encourage him to follow the situation further until I spoke to the Captain. In fact, I believe I actually advised the Ensign to refrain from doin’ anythin’ at all; as I said, I hadn’t even discussed such matters with my own commanding officer.” (edited)
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 16-Mar-20 07:13 PM
[Capri] "Maybe you need to check his hearing then. Because he went ahead and started investigating without talking to his senior officer. And the way I understand it, you never bothered to tell him to speak with said senior officer first. Considering the sensitivity of this information, it could almost be seen as a breach of patient privacy with you discussing it so openly with someone who isnt a part of medical, and who's also been raving like some paranoid maniac."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 07:18 PM
"Wait a minute." Oskar finally said, his face tired of all this bickering. "I went to the Doctor with concerns about her death. I was doing my job by performing the official death investigation. When I asked her about anything that may seem suspicious, she said she had suspicions about the death. She never divulged information that could be seen as a breach of patient confidentiality. I tacked that onto the regular investigation, as it ruled under potential foul play. Then I went to you with the little theories I had and then our boss showed up. When we presented him with the evidence, what did he do immediately after that? Hm?" (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 07:20 PM
"These investigations are a team effort. Finger-pointing, squabbling and insults will not find commander Zoyill for us." He growled, having simply sat quietly and listened to them talk for the past few sentences - part of him had begun to regret placing the two of them on the team. "You will work together in your investigations with a minimum of argument for the time being; we can figure out the rest when the subject of this discussion is properly apprehended." He swept his gaze over the two bickering ensigns; honey golden eyes now glinting with barely concealed anger. "It was not without much consideration that we decided to include the two of you in the investigations at this stage. Do not squander this opportunity. Is that understood?"
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 16-Mar-20 07:22 PM
[Capri] "The point still stands, Oskar. You and the CMO both neglected to come to me before doing any sort of deep dive. This isn't some old earth spy novel where you can just do whatever you want. You have to report to me before taking any steps forward. Even Giles agreed with that,"
Waiting on Blanche to respond. She needs a chance to react also)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 07:25 PM
"And then Giles hacked into classified medical records, Capri. Then what happened? He agreed with the theory that something was suspicious. Confidentiality be damned in this case. We've already broken the confidentiality rule." Oskar felt his temper rising to borderline screaming. He kept his cool and looked at the Captain. "Understood, sir." (edited)
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 16-Mar-20 07:26 PM
[Capri] "Not the point! I've already chewed you out once for this, and I said would have words with the CMO about this as well. Remember?" He looked back at Blanche, waiting for a response.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 16-Mar-20 07:38 PM
Between Capri’s persistence, and the mention of hacking into the medical system, Blanche looked utterly bewildered. “Ensign, I’m findin’ it difficult to understand your insistence that I should have consulted you, given my precious clarification that I hadn’t intended on sharin’ anythin’ beyond senior staff. I report to Captain Dunamis, and did so after an intelligence officer approached me with suspicions; your own officer’s curiosity, I’m afraid, does not automatically provide you clearance to become involved in an otherwise classified situation. Quite frankly, what I find a little more troublin’ is your talk of ‘breaches’. It seems your department was more than happy to violate data protocol, and not only did you fail to inform me after we established department cooperation, you accused me of failin’ to preserve that same confidentiality!” (edited)
5
5
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 16-Mar-20 07:41 PM
[Capri] "Said intelligence officer never bothered to even report to me about this situation until after the fact. This is the thing that I'm having an issue with. The potential breach was only a brief concern,"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 07:49 PM
"Ensign King. Ensign Schneider." He growled - no, snarled now - rising from his seat at the head of the conference room table. His hands, grasping the edge of the table, tightened their grasp, leaving indentations in the metal. His mood was low already, and these two and their squabbling did absolutely nothing to improve his mood. "Allow me to repeat myself. This is a team effort. The two of you given the opportunity to assist and you would do well not to squander it. Finger-pointing, assigning blame and squabbling will not catch commander Zoyill. The two of you will set about the task given to you without the latter three things and that is final! Is that understood?" By the end of his sentence, his volume had gone up some, bordering the point of yelling. His whole body trembled with barely concealed anger, and in fact he looked fit to snap at any given moment. (edited)
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 16-Mar-20 07:52 PM
[Capri] "Understood Captain. All I was trying to point out was that there needs to be communication among all of those involved. Doctor Carlisle, Schneider, and myself all need to be on the same page and we can't do that if we dont keep each other clued in,"
Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 07:53 PM
Oskar looked at the Captain. He was hiding a chuckle from the nervousness. "Understood, sir. Zoyill will be caught." Oskar said, his tone of voice was almost fearful. Like a child. He hid fear and childhood memories in his eyes. "We will report to you when we have new evidence for Zoyill." Oskar almost facepalmed himself when Capri said that.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 07:54 PM
"Dismissed." He sat back down again, biting back the rage that threatened to break out and beset itself upon these two childish, infantile- no, Dune. Calm down, calm down. Calm calm calm...
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 16-Mar-20 07:55 PM
[Capri] "Understood." Capri stood quickly and walked out.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 16-Mar-20 07:55 PM
"Aye, sir. All our evidence is on this PADD." Oskar set a PADD on the table and quickly made his exit. He didn't want to be there longer than he had to.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 16-Mar-20 07:58 PM
Blanche watched the doors hiss shut after the two had left, equally as shaken by the Captain’s sudden outburst. In all honesty, she had rolled her eyes upon Capri’s last words, though had made sure the gesture went unseen by Dunamis, who was evidently worn beyond measure. “Captain, I’d advise you to take the rest of this shift off. That was drainin’ to say the least, but we made progress all the same. I don’t want you gettin’ worked up over this.”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 16-Mar-20 08:03 PM
He opened his mouth to reply, expression stuck somewhere between angry and tired, as if to snap at her... but he took a deep breath in, letting it reach his core and calm him down. THis was not the time to get worked up. The crew needed him as a beacon of strength, as an example... and he would not be so angry and seething with fury. "I will manage, doctor, thank you. Progress has been made in our investigations and that is all that matters at this stage. I only wish that I do not regret my decision to include the two of them; their arguments concern me deeply." And with that, out the door he walked without a backward glance.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 16-Mar-20 08:09 PM
And Carlisle was left alone in the conference room, just a little dumbfounded. What in high hell. For some time, the woman felt less than motivated to leave, half expecting the mindless bickering to have continued beyond the confines of the room. Instead, she found herself once more studying those damned charts, eyes distant, illuminated by the images’ continued flickering. Oh, what Khassid would have had to say about all this. Flicking the holo-emitter off, Blanche eventually left the conference room, somehow more baffled than she’d entered. (edited)

Commander Blanche Carlisle 27-Mar-20 04:28 PM

She'd refrained from glaring daggers at Khassid for her retreat from sickbay; the Commodore had enough on her plate, quite evidently.
the-invalid-user 27-Mar-20 04:29 PM
To stayed sitting, frowning a touch as he watched the others leave the room, looking over at the Commodore occasionally, noting the one's shame as they realized just how much they had been talking over the revived Cardassian and apologized to Khassid. (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Mar-20 04:32 PM

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 27-Mar-20 04:33 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Mar-20 04:34 PM
"Now, Commander." He took the older Kelpien by the shoulder and led him to the window. "You might know that as circumstances are, we do not have a first officer."
5
5
5
4
the-invalid-user 27-Mar-20 04:36 PM
Tor stood and followed him, his frown deepening. "Yessir." Tor nodded, silently berating himself. Admittedly, he hadn't noticed the lack of a first officer, but looking back, it was an obvious fact... And he had an idea why Dune was bringing it up, but he'd let the younger Kelpien say what he had on mind.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Mar-20 04:42 PM
"I cannot bear the load alone. The crew needs an additional voice, another person to whom they can look. Looking at your record and your actions thus far I would like to offer you the position of acting first officer on top of your duties as chief tactical officer. Your deputies are competent all; I have no doubt that they will be able to handle the brunt of your duties for you."
the-invalid-user 27-Mar-20 04:47 PM
Tor was quiet as he thought about it. At first, his instinct was to gently refuse the offer. After all, he'd never been one for command. But, thinking about it, all of it in consideration, he was one of the best suited for the job, and if the Captain believed him to be able.. Well, he couldn't disappoint. Not the Captain, or the crew. "If you believe me to be the best suitable candidate sir, I will take the responsibility with.. Gratitude, sir."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Mar-20 04:49 PM
"You will do splendidly, Commander. I believe sincerely that you will. I think that there is much more kindness in you that meets the eye, though it might not be readily apparent. And I know that you will fight to defend this crew with your very life."
the-invalid-user 27-Mar-20 04:51 PM
Tor looked out the window, processing Dune's compliments. "I will do everything in my power to make sure I don't fail those expectations, sir... And I would gladly give my life for the crew." That, he didn't have to hesitate to say.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Mar-20 04:59 PM
"Good. We both have a task ahead of us; making sure that this operation is successful. But beyond that still, ensuring that no one acts rashly. Discretion is the name of this game, and anything but will not be favorable."
the-invalid-user 27-Mar-20 05:02 PM
"Yessir." Tor nodded at this. "I'll make sure it stays off the radar, sir. As for the operation's success, we can only do so much. We'll just have to trust our Intelligence and the one Science personnel know how to act well... Though I can think of a few things we can do if it begins going south."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Mar-20 05:06 PM
"What are you thoughts?" He settled on one of the conference room chairs, interlacing his long, slender fingers together. (edited)
the-invalid-user 27-Mar-20 05:12 PM
"For one thing, sir, if our suspect begins to think that our operatives aren't who they say they are, we, well, distract him, with a new problem. Say, an innocent crew of the USS Phoenix needing his assistance with a problem in his field, just, not necessarily with a new plague, but a," he put his hands up and made the quotation signs. "'new' sickness our medical staff can't identify."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Mar-20 05:14 PM
"And from there? What would we do?"
the-invalid-user 27-Mar-20 05:20 PM
"Well, from there, we engineer a false sickness, similar to the virus, but distinct enough to not arouse suspicion, see if he can't manipulate it to make it, well, cured. Course, we can't give him any real samples, because any contact with our subject would cause it to spread rapidly, so he would work with what little we've been able to, well, 'collect'. If he can manipulate it successfully, we'll know for certain he's able to manipulate these successfully.. And from there, if our operatives are unsuccessful, we can do what else I have in mind, but it would be... Risky, at best, sir, and honestly, I hope it won't come to it."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Mar-20 05:23 PM
"I hope not." He quirked an eyebrow still though, a little bit of surprised grin playing across his lips. "You have a good amount of cunning in you, don't you? Rather unusual..."
the-invalid-user 27-Mar-20 05:26 PM

Lt. JG. Rémy Salarda 28-Mar-20 05:38 PM

I have some questions regarding the conference held here yesterday" his voice had softened for a moment while stating how glad he was to meet the captain, to be replaced by a somewhat cold gaze shortly after. He was on-duty, and had a job to perform. While the golden eyes may be alluring, this man had yet to earn his trust.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 28-Mar-20 05:39 PM
"Of course. Please do ask - I will give you what information I can." The cold gaze barely bothered him; some of his old commanders had given him worse.
Lt. JG. Rémy Salarda 28-Mar-20 05:44 PM
"Well sir, first of all, in the conference the commander in question is addressed as if he has been found guilty already, yet no hard proof has been presented. Now I do not wish to undermine the authority of either you nor the commadore, but truth be told, this mission would be operated in a grey area, and you have yet to earn my confidence, even if whatever brief interactions I had with the crew as of yet, have given me hope that you believe to be speaking the truth, at least." His tone and posture had not changed, though he hoped he had not offended the captain, whose golden eyes were met with lamps of the same glow, however telling a different story
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 28-Mar-20 05:48 PM
"I am acutely aware that there has been no proof found, which is why I have dispatched three of our crew to find it. Lieutenant, I wish I could see a better, less clandestine way to do this. Alas, I cannot." He admitted, grip on the armrests of his chair tightening some. "Perhaps we might be right. Or we could be horrendously wrong, and commander Zoyill could be innocent, as he purports himself to be. I only wish I knew that I could assure myself of the former possibility."
Lt. JG. Rémy Salarda 28-Mar-20 05:55 PM
"Ah.. Well you understand that if wrong, sir, you and several others may be punished, seeing how some proposed options of this the mission would be in direct violation of Federation and Starfleet regulation? If it would come to a direct confrontation in which the crew from our ship would have to use violence against this mister Zoyill, and the proof we so very much desire has not been found, they would quite possibly face a court-marshall, as well as others on this ship." While saying this his gaze changed, if only at times, which reflected some worry for his crewmates, as they, like him, will not disobey an order from their captain.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 28-Mar-20 06:02 PM
"We will not use violence. I trust all the crew to exercise discretion and restraint; they are people of character all. As for the possibility that we are wrong..." A long, heaving sigh, and his gaze was cast downward to the tabletop. "I accept it, though I pray that it does not come to that. Exitus acta probat, as humans say - the ends justify the means. While not fully applicable to our circumstances, I only wish that it wasn't the maxim that rang the truest."
Lt. JG. Rémy Salarda 28-Mar-20 06:09 PM
"I see, sir, thank you, that is all I wanted to know, it seems you have full confidence in your crew, and they give you the same in return, I only hope that you are right. Do understand that this is something I had to ask captain, I would expect the same from anyone serving under me, who has no reason to count on the fact that my decisions are the right ones yet. It was good to meet you, and this short conversation has given me the slightest bit of hope that this ship's future is in the right hands." The cold man within Cosek seemed to briefly make room for a warmer person while he spoke that last sentence, though anyone could make out the utter seriousness of his statements with one look in his gilded eyes
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 28-Mar-20 06:14 PM
"Phoenix's future is bright, lieutenant, fear not. Its crew is resilient beyond measure, and its compassion and drive even more so. They will go far. They are the shining future of Starfleet, I say. They shall bring light wherever they go, like the namesake of the ship they serve on." A slightly brighter smile now, though there was a tinge of sadness creeping in. First meeting and you're boring this poor man with Phoenix analogies. Really?
Lt. JG. Rémy Salarda 28-Mar-20 06:16 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 30-Mar-20 07:33 PM

"Test doctors Clark and Carlisle first and foremost; they have spent the most time around her as her caretakers, so to speak. If anything I have spent less time in her presence than they. Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-20 07:37 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 30-Mar-20 07:40 PM

jshoey18 30-Mar-20 07:45 PM

Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 06-May-20 02:28 AM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-May-20 02:33 AM
"I realize that now. I shall do my best to never, ever repeat that - lest of course, absolutely necessary," He turned back around, tapping on the wall console, which pulled up a map of the Gamma quadrant. Locations were marked sporadically around the map - locations of Dominion fleets. "She showed me this information - she informed me that the Dominion intends to exterminate all Jem'hadar of the lieutenant's breed. And that she was threatened. By whom, she did not say, though I can guess." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 06-May-20 03:06 AM
“It better not happen again. Things like that spread like wildfire. Reputations get ruined and you never know who’s listening. Good or bad.” His legs crossed, hand going to pick at the side of his jaw. “I can guess as well. This information was relayed to Starfleet Command, correct?” (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-May-20 03:09 AM
"Yes. Starfleet Command is fully aware of this; I sat in on the conversation as she spoke. What worries, me though..." He muttered, turning around and massaging the bridge of his nose. "I don't know. Who exactly gave her this information? What reason have we to believe that it is authentic? And why would the Dominion want to exterminate one of their strongest links to us? Lest they wish to cede from the Khitomer Alliance of course..."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 06-May-20 03:14 AM
"Do you really think someone would lie about this?" His hands came together in a thin triangle, placing elbows on the table. "Consider this, Dunamis. You're a Vorta who's finally been freed of your confines. Then - that freedom is suddenly taken away by your ultimate suppressor. Would you lie about your enemy?" There was a simple shake of his head. "No you wouldn't" "It's a stupid idea, they'd have the entire quadrant against them in seconds. But knowing them - a Jem'Hadar with the power to expose the innerworkings of the Dominion is far too dangerous to let run around. It's a dream that other Jem'Hadar could reach: Freedom in Starfleet. If that dream is squashed, what's the point in revolting?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-May-20 03:22 AM
He hummed in agreement and nodded, sitting down at last with his head in his hands. "There'd be none. Which brings us to our next topic. We need to protect them both, somehow - what if the Dominion finds out that she failed to carry out her task, and her target is still alive? Like I said there is a cloaked shuttle due to arrive soon, to collect her and the body."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 06-May-20 03:49 AM
“Then we destroy the shuttle pod, that’ll be more than confirmation that she was correct. We should keep an eye on them both but I doubt anything else will happen. Security does need to be upped on the ship.” Kun leaned back in his chair, mouth going into a fine line. “I also doubt they will continue any form of oppression. Considering Hatsumomo’s dealing with the matter. They won’t try again.”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-May-20 03:53 AM
"Let us hope not. Amidst the currently ongoing Breen threat I don't know how much more stress we can take. Especially when it is with regards to one of the Alliance's strongest members. After what we have given them in the course of their membership I shudder to think what they could do with their current state of technology, and with the correct leadership and motivation."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 06-May-20 04:14 AM
“This isn’t stressful, you are making it stressful.” He corrected. “And until they convince someone to their side - they aren’t a threat. They’ve lost against the quadrant before, they’ll lose again.”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-May-20 04:19 AM
Another hum of agreement, and he laid his head in his hands with a weary sigh. "Yes. I'm sorry, Commander - amidst our recent experiences I think I am a bit too predisposed to... looking a bit too deeply into things. Too pessimistic."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 06-May-20 04:29 AM
"You don't need to apologize. A change is needed, that's all. But remember, the crew looks up to you. If they see you like this - it'll simply reflect back on them."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-May-20 04:34 AM
"Stay positive, stay motivated and they shall too. It's what they need - what they deserve. From you and I both. Yes, you are right."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 06-May-20 04:36 AM
"I am. Now why don't we head back? I believe this discussion has concluded and I'm sure we both have something to get to," He stood up, pushing himself up by using the table. "I appreciate the briefing."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-May-20 04:37 AM
"We do indeed." He agreed, standing and making his way back up to the bridge.

The man now occupying his office has forced the Great Houses to submit to his opponent views of the Federation, and Alliance in totality, I might wager. Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 12-May-20 04:08 AM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 12-May-20 04:13 AM
"Yes." More tapping on the screen pulled up the formation of fifteen vessels with the Breen ships in the middle, almost like a web or net. "A few vessels will serve as decoys with skeleton crews while fifteen others surround the Breen and create an electromagnetic net so to speak, disabling them. We will transport aboard their crews and question them - humanely of course. Find out what we can from them,"
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 12-May-20 04:23 AM
"Got it, not a bad idea I'd say. But still on the dangerous side."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 12-May-20 04:25 AM
"I don't see any other way to do this, number one. The Breen will not give up information easily; that is a given. But we must know about the why and from there figure out the what next. If the Klingons are sponsoring them to do this then we must proceed with caution,"
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 12-May-20 04:27 AM
"I didn't ask for another reason to do this. I'm simply pointing out that the task in it of itself has it faults. There is not a doubt in my mind that the Klingons are on their side. How much they're aiding them - I don't know."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 12-May-20 04:29 AM
"Information which we would have to find out - hopefully soon. I believe you saw the eight medical vessels that were heavily damaged and barely functional. We cannot afford many more casualties."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 12-May-20 04:32 AM
"I did and I know that. The Federation hasn't faltered before, doubt it will now." There was a slight coolness to his words, like he knew exactly what he wanted to say and how to put it.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 12-May-20 04:36 AM
"It will not. The Alliance will not falter. The Federation has survived worse and come our stronger than ever before; no doubt it will again."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 12-May-20 04:38 AM
He fought the urge to call him a parrot, like a broken record this man. "Why don't you head to your quarters then. I'll take your shift tonight. You've already had enough of a day." Kun gave the tall man a pat on the chest. "I'll call you in if anything happens."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 12-May-20 04:40 AM
"I'd appreciate it, commander; thank you so very much." He would force a smile onto his face and shuffle out of the conference room, shoulder slumped. Clearly there was a bit more bothering him than there was at prima facie.
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 12-May-20 04:43 AM
Kunzo wasn't going to ask. He could really only do so much as the First Officer. He didn't care for emotions all too much in his position - especially when he can just fill in that role for someone. With a turn on the heel, he turned off the console and walked off.

Captain Syrezeaju 22-Jun-20 11:51 PM

The Federation could not have been restored without you. You are free to leave - including those reconditioned. You have proven your innocence by helping today. Please remember that counselling and support staff are here if any of you require it."

Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 08:26 PM
It was to here that Syre had wandered, quite content to take a slow walk about the ship and get to know the layout. Understanding how the bridge was structured was something in itself and as a result she had ended up here. Rather convenient considering how she was planning on calling a staff meeting. There were still people that she needed to meet, departments she needed to check up with, and was there a better way than this? Dragging out a chair at the head of the table she took her place and then proceeded to send out a message to the senior staff, hoping that at least some of them might be able to attend given the late notice.

BonBon 18-Oct-20 08:40 PM
Varis made her way into the conference room. Her Starfleet unfirom was the usual, pressed to perfection. Her hair was also usual though, pulled into a slightly messy bun at the back of her head. Brown eyes surveyed the room as she entered, taking note of those who were there already. She stood tall, and obviously with some pride. She smiled to the Captain and walked over to her at once. "Hello Captain, Lieutenant Commander Varis, Chief Tactical Officer." She introduced herself promptly and efficiently. Where she might have her staff peel bananas for her and assign them numbers instead of bothering to remember their names, she did offer the Captain plenty of respect. She glanced to Amanda. "What happened to you? Someone beat me to it?" She gave her a quick grin. Then turned her attention back to the commanding officer in the room, but gave her some space after her introduction, knowing full well she was likely about to get swarmed, so Varis peeled away and went to find a replicator to get a cup of coffee.

Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 08:51 PM
A quizzical look was given to Higgins at her explanation, being fully aware that holodeck safeties were supposed to remain switched on, but she didn't question it. What was interesting was the quip of the Romulan who entered the room. Red uniform stripe, Lieutenant Commander rank pips - CTO. Some sort of existing rapport between the two of them existed, then, which was good. As for the rest... She kept looking back and forth to look over the group, taking in appearances and trying to put names to them. She would learn them along the way. "Is this all of us?" She enquired once they had settled down, clicking the screen of her PADD off. "If we could just settle now, if that's alright- sorry for interrupting any conversations," she then added with a smile. "And sorry for dragging you all up here on such short notice." "Anyway. Thought it might be about time that I introduced myself to those I could. I'm Syrezeaju - just call me Syre - and I'll be serving as your new commanding officer. Phoenix looks like a good ship and those I've met so far have been great to get to know; I'm definitely looking forwards to it. Issue is that I barely know any of you guys yet. Anyone want to start us off? Name, department, any sort of information that you want to add..."

Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 08:56 PM

Was it authorised through Medical, and was it reported back to myself or the XO..? Sorry, I'd just like to check."
Commander T'Svai 18-Oct-20 08:58 PM
"It was authorized through Medical and is of no great importance, sir." T'Svai replied completely neutrally, though it was pretty clear that she had no intention whatsoever of clarifying further.
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 08:59 PM
Her quizzical expression deepened. The Rigellian may not have had eyebrows but the expression was still there. "Of course it's of great importance, you're the Chief Operations Officer. You're a department head - kind of the sort of person that's called upon to lead the division..?"
Commander T'Svai 18-Oct-20 09:00 PM
T'Svai was starting to realize she maybe was not making the best first impression right about now. She raised an eyebrow. "Which I am still doing, as evidenced by my presence here. Shall we continue?"
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 09:01 PM
She sat back in her chair then, arms folding across her chest. "Mhm, we can continue - but I'd appreciate it if we could have a word at the end of this. Next?"
10
BonBon 18-Oct-20 09:04 PM
Varis looked at the replicator and tapped in a command for coffee with a sort of cream from a sort of livestock on New Romulus, which apparently the replicator didn't like at first. It gave a disapproving sound, before Varis tapped in another code, and the coffee materialized. She picked it up and made her way back towards the large conference table. She wasn't used to having THIS many people in here. She had her usual sour, serious look on her face and continually glanced over the room before she took a drink of the hot beverage. Then she heard the Captain's request for information and her face got even MORE sour. It sounded like a team building exercise, and she really, was not a fan of those. She set the cup down for a moment and her nose wrinkled like there was something foul smelling right beneath it as she thought of something to say. After a moment she did say something. "I'm Lieutenant Commander Varis. Chief of Tactical. This is my second posting with Starfleet the first was with the Ibn Fadlan." She didn't elaborate but it wasn't a large secret the ship was destroyed during the battle with the Tal Shiar. "Before then I worked with the Romulans." She also didn't elaborate on that work but some people in attendance had inklings, she did know. The Captain also likely had access to her personnel file. Then she dug for something personal to tell them all, and she really didn't like sharing that so she just came up with something. "I-I grew up on Vulcan." There. That wasn't too much. Though she did watch the talk between the Chief of Ops and the Captain with interest she said nothing. Though clearly she had something on her mind.
Commander T'Svai 18-Oct-20 09:06 PM
T'Svai perked up slightly. She'd grown up on Vulcan? Fascinating. That merited some conversation later. She made a mental note.
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 18-Oct-20 09:06 PM
Amanda sat up a bit straighter as she narrowed her eyes at Varis before introducing herself. "I am Lieutenant Commander Amanda Higgins, Chief Engineer. My job is to keep the ship from blowing up and/or bursting into flames. I'm an ex-borg from New York on Earth aaaaannnndddd..." she looked directly at Varis. "I enjoy boxing and brazilian jiu jitsu and Varis you did not get beat to it because I wouldn't allow you to hit me at all." (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 18-Oct-20 09:07 PM
Sara had sat down at some point, looking over the accrued party with a soft smile. This was fun! She'd never really had a chance to talk with the other department heads other than Amanda on a regular basis.
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 09:08 PM
She had went to comment on the CTO's introduction, even just a quick 'pleasure to meet you' or something of the sort - not that the Romulan made it seem like a pleasure, considering how she had grimaced as soon as introductions were suggested. The opportunity was taken immediately, though, by the CEO interjecting. Definitely some sort of existing rapport - or rivalry? - between the two. As long as it didn't get in the way of their work while on duty, then...
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 18-Oct-20 09:10 PM
Maggie smiled at T’Svai, ￼ remembering the time that had spoken of children’s shows. Then sending a nod towards Varis and Amanda. Before beginning to speak after ￼realizing that the captain wasn’t going to say anything to Amanda or Varis. “Hi! I’m￼ Lieutenant￼ Maggie Verne, formally known as Roode. I’m the ACTO. Something that I feel like should be mentioned is that very soon there’ll be a new ACTO. Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb. Who I’m in the process of training up for the role, I think he should be good to take the rank within the coming week. I’ll still be here of course, just in an reduced role of course.”
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 09:11 PM
"Uh... I don't believe that's how it works?" Confusion seemed to be the expression of the day. "Not that I'm entirely up to date on the goings-on aboard this ship, but it's my understanding that a second ACTO is being trained up - not one to replace you. I'd also like to know how that 'training' is going, if that's alright? Noticed nothing's been logged in a while."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 18-Oct-20 09:13 PM
Maggie raised an eyebrow as she looked at the captain. Before shaking her head, damn her for a fool. She sat down as she thought it over.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 18-Oct-20 09:19 PM
Blanche had been observing the conversation with a slight grimace, although the woman was quick to revert to her usual sunniness once her 'turn' approached. "Doctor Blanche Carlisle," she mused with a warm smile, "Chief Medical Officer. One who would very much appreciate her peers refrainin' from beatin' each other black and blue."

7
BonBon 18-Oct-20 09:26 PM
Varis took another sip of her coffee and smirked at Amanda, "Yea we'll see." It was entirely friendly banter, at least from Varis. Then she looked to Blanche. "You'd have hated the Ibn Fadlan we used to have 'dance' nights." By which she meant nights when they'd all get together and blow off steam by fighting in a controlled setting. Certainly not Starfleet protocol. She was actually paying attention to what everyone was saying though. It was good to get more information about everyone, even if she wasn't exactly the most friendly sort on the Senior Staff.

Commander T'Svai 18-Oct-20 09:27 PM

Lieutenant Malcolm Parsons 18-Oct-20 09:31 PM
"Hello, all. I would just like to say welcome aboard captain sorry I didn't have a chance to say that before in the Engineering briefing when we first met." Malcolm paused, he smiled as his head swiveled to look at everyone in the conference room. "As to your question, I'm Lieutenant Junior Grade, Malcolm Parsons, the Assistant Chief Engineer. I grew up on Earth in San Francisco. I was a warp Engineer when I first started out in Starfleet RND working on warp field dynamics and nacelles that were subspace friendly. I think my favorite part of this ship though is I get to work with the most incredible engineers in the galaxy every day it is an honor to help Commander Higgin's lead a group of such amazing Officers."
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 09:32 PM

"But thank you, Lieutenant Parsons - I'm glad that you're happy to be here and that you've been getting along with the rest of the team. You all sound like good folk." Red eyes swept over the table and the officers amassed there - until they fell upon Sara, knowing that the science officer had not yet spoken.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 18-Oct-20 09:32 PM
Guess it was her turn.. "Hallo! Very happy to meet you, Captain. I'm Lieutenant Sara Bjørge, Chief of Science. I'm from the Lofoten islands in Northern Norway, and also the former curator of the arboretum. I'm enrolled in Starfleets off-campus PhD program and have actually already named a new fruit after the Phoenix! I like to dry tea and fruits in my spare time- and have had a recent interest renewal in old-fashioned cooking." That was very short and sweet she thought, everything she needed to know and a fun tidbit!.. Goodness her nerves were alight though!
6
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 09:36 PM
"Perfect! It's a pleasure to meet all of you, and I'll do my best to get to know the others who aren't here - I'll catch up with them sooner or later. Anyway. I've been trying to catch up with what's been going on around here, taking notes from different projects and the likes. I've noticed that tactical were doing very well but have fallen behind a little bit - has something come up that's holding you guys back? Anything that I can lend a hand with?" The remainder of the question was asked with a look towards Varis and Verne, knowing that they were the only ones here who could answer.
BonBon 18-Oct-20 09:47 PM
Varis set her coffee down when she heard the next bit. Oh boy. "Behind?" Her head simply went to one side. Her brown eyes seemed to have a new sort of intensity to them, and her shoulders rippled back, making her stand even taller than she had been, her jaw set tight. "Lieutenant Maleb has his CTATs program that I've been intending to implement on holodeck training modules but I decided to wait until his training was finished so that I could fully utilize him in his role as ACTO before implementing his software with my own training programs, as when we last spoke he mentioned some bugs. Weapons lockers throughout the ship have been checked and stocked with a variety of weapons in case of any boarding actions, all have been documented and checked to be certain they are in working order. Other than that I'm not sure what you're referring to when you're saying that we are behind, Captain." She glanced through her PADD to see if she had missed any assignments or projects assigned to the department. God help the souls of her poor department after hearing that they were behind. She gave a glance to Maggie and it was a look that could freeze the fires of hell.
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 09:54 PM
"Behind in that there hasn't been any form of update given in over a week. Nothing about this alleged ACTO training which Lieutenant Verne there apparently has been running, nothing about this 'CTATs' programme, nothing from yourself. Now I fully understand if you're all too busy to note things down formally - but if you don't, then know one else is going to know. As far as I can gauge it seems like Lieutenant Maleb's training has all but come to a standstill. But don't worry-" she mock waved the worry away with a swish of a hand. "-I'll catch up with him at some point and find out what's been going on." "Next... Science. Noticed you keep up to date with a main log at least once a week, which is perfect. I know you haven't held the position for too long, Lieutenant Bjørge. You also mentioned that your main specialism is in botany. How have you been finding managing to co-ordinate those from the different scientific branches? I'll try to find you an ACSO as soon as."
BonBon 18-Oct-20 09:58 PM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 18-Oct-20 09:59 PM

Currently we're not overloaded with work, so I have a few ensigns who are working on personal projects within the department and two in engineering. Anything to report from your department? I know it's been quiet for you lot recently."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 18-Oct-20 10:32 PM
