Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 10:34 PM
"That's quite alright, if there's not much for you to do then there's not much to do. Maybe run some drills and co-ordinate with the other departments on things; emergency preparedness would be good, I've noticed that it's been a year since the last drills. But if that's all from you then that just leaves us with Medical. Now I'm not going to lie, I thought that 'Lieutenant Olson' must be the CMO or something, judging from how they've been submitting daily logs." She paused and flicked her hair over her shoulder, shrugging while doing so. "I appreciate the officer's dedication but - they do know they don't have to do that, right?"
Commander Blanche Carlisle 18-Oct-20 10:46 PM
The Rigellian's remark prompted a light-hearted laugh from Blanche, who took a moment to sweep her own hair from her eyes before replying. "That'd be our chief nurse, Captain. She's awful set on maintainin' a, uhm—," her face fell in a thankfully brief attempt of remembrance. "A streak, that's it!" The mention of Amy brought a fond smile to Blanche's face nonetheless, who spun gently where she sat at the table. "Nothin' out of the ordinary to report otherwise, I'm pleased to say. We've been doin' alright in terms of staff; the new ACMO was cleared for duty earlier today, actually!"
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 10:49 PM
"I'm glad to hear that you've managed to get the position filled, and as amusing as your Chief Nurse's continuous logs are, dedication is a good thing to hear from all of the officers. Now..." She sat forwards this time, arms still crossed but this time against the desk to the edge of the table. "Is there anything that any of you guys want to bring up while you're here? Suggestions of what might need done ship-wide - I know about the physicals - any assistance you might need from myself or the XO, any questions you have for me. Whatever it is I'll try to answer."
Commander T'Svai 18-Oct-20 11:00 PM
"I cannot think of anything on Operations' behalf, sir." T'Svai replied honestly, since there was a chance mere silence would be construed as hesitance.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 18-Oct-20 11:04 PM
Following the mention of the physicals, Blanche merely gave a gentle shake of her head. Blue eyes narrowed briefly in thought, but the doctor’s warm smile was unfailing. “Nothin’ I can think of besides the exams you mentioned, Captain.”
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 18-Oct-20 11:06 PM
"Engineering is just fine captain, nothing to worry about," She said, glancing over at Blanche and pointing to her eye, indicating she wanted to get it fixed after the meeting.
2
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 11:09 PM
With a nod she looked out over the group again. "Well if that's everything then I'm happy to conclude this meeting. Thank you all for coming up here at such a short notice, and if you do have anything that you'd like to bring up in private then I'll be lingering here for a while. Dismissed - enjoy the rest of your day, guys!"
Commander T'Svai 18-Oct-20 11:14 PM
T'Svai, having been asked to stay, stayed where she was.
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 18-Oct-20 11:15 PM
Amanda rose and waited to see if Blanche would agree to tend to her eye.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 18-Oct-20 11:24 PM
"Thank you, Captain!" Blanche met Amanda's gesture with a knowing smile, and sidled over to the CEO once the group had been dismissed. Inclining her head towards the ramps, the doctor motioned for Amanda to follow. "Come on, you."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 18-Oct-20 11:25 PM
Amanda walked out with Blanche.
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 11:27 PM
[D] Once the others had left it was just Syre and T'Svai remaining. Propping her elbow up on the table and placing her chin into her hand, she looked to the Vulcan with a look which might have been one of confusion - bordering being unimpressed. "So, Commander. You're off duty - but you're not. Medical thinks you're off duty. The roster and both myself and the XO thinks you're on duty. You show up to a meeting which is on duty, and you hold your own meeting despite. Being. 'Off duty.' Do you wanna elaborate on that for me? Maybe clarify a little? Because there's just something that I ain't really getting, there."
Commander T'Svai 18-Oct-20 11:38 PM
"With all due respect, sir, your words are distinctly confrontational, and thus while I will indeed now clarify it is with a certain measure of hesitation." T'Svai said without any hint of emotion. She clasped her hands in front of her on the table and eyed the new Captain. "Your confusion, however, is understandable. Recently, before you came aboard to my recollection, and thus before a report could be issued to you, I experienced some medical difficulty. The specifics would be somewhat time consuming to elucidate. Suffice to say, I died, recovered, then spent a great deal of time on repairs and so on afterwards without thought, on the assumption that as a Vulcan such a decision would yield no problems. I was obviously incorrect. My instructions from medical were to avoid physically strenuous work and low-temperature areas, for example the Jefferies tubes, until the...medical issues subsided. I have met with my department to redelegate the tasks of that nature I would ordinarily complete myself in order to make that possible, and as I would not characterize either that meeting or this one as physically strenuous, I am therefore within the guidelines specified by Medical. I will confirm that I did not report the change in schedule to Commander Dunamis, however, I have only recently finished making the appropriate arrangements myself, and the report would have been contained within the same work log describing the meeting I had with my department in part to discuss precisely that issue. I trust my explanation is clear?" She recited somewhat mechanically, raising an eyebrow to punctuate her final statement. (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 11:39 PM
There was silence as the Vulcan spoke. In turn, the Rigellian merely tilted her head to the side. "So you're not off duty, then? 'S really all I asked, Commander. You're changing your mind again."
Commander T'Svai 18-Oct-20 11:41 PM
The eyebrow lowered. "It is a difficult question to definitively answer. I am exclusively delegating, and do not have a set duty shift for the time being, to clarify. My stance has not changed."
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-20 11:45 PM
"Alright, I'm gonna simplify this for the sake of us both. Either you're relieved of duty or you're not. If you are then you aren't working. If you aren't then you're still working - and you can work within those, how did you say it, the 'guidelines' set out by Medical. Taking your time to recover from something as vast as that occasion is perfectly understandable, Commander, but make sure you communicate next time. You're a department head. Your job depends on it." She lowered the hand which had been propping up her chin, looking back down to the PADD in front of her again. Silvery skin seemed translucent in the light of the PADD compared to the dullness of the room. "Dismissed." (edited)
Commander T'Svai 18-Oct-20 11:50 PM
There goes the eyebrow again, ascending to heights never before seen. She took a moment to kind of size the new captain up, squinted slightly, opened her mouth to say something, thought better of it, closed her mouth, nodded sharply, then left the conference room. Dismissal was dismissal, after all.
Commander T'Svai 19-Oct-20 12:00 AM
Ding!
To: Captain Syrezeaju From: Lt. Cmdr. T'Svai
>
Captain Syrezeaju,
>
As of less than a minute ago, I have been cleared to return to duty, thus rendering our most recent conversation moot. I apologize for any confusion.
>
Sincerely, Lt. Cmdr. T'Svai
Captain Syrezeaju 19-Oct-20 12:29 AM
Syrezeaju had watched the Chief Operations Officer leave. Red eyes did not bore into the other women's back, though, instead they remained focussed but entirely neutral. Syre didn't enjoy telling people off. This sort of time was difficult. There was the effort to pick up the slack from a previous captain and introduce her way of doing things while not forcing their own routine too far out of shape. It took a bit of sternness that she rather wouldn't have had to display at this stage. Whatever was necessary in order to keep things functioning, at the end of the day. She just hoped that the Vulcan wouldn't think too hardly of her - or do something silly to prove she was capable. She seemed the sort to try to power and keep on working even if she was bleeding from every orifice. Dedication and tenacity was appreciated but something that Syre always valued was health above all else. There was no point in wearing yourself down into the dirt and she hoped that this was something the Vulcan understood. It was in the midst of her musing that the message came through. Okay... Let's reply and see how the COO feels. This was the perfect platform for quick amends.

Keep making plans in the background but ensure their consent before we enact them?"
Commander T'Svai 21-Oct-20 10:08 PM
"That is logical." Not that T'Svai was particularly eager to contact two potentially hostile species and contaminate the planet's history and culture any further, but that had no basis here given the level of potential danger.
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 21-Oct-20 10:09 PM

Remi-chan 21-Oct-20 10:09 PM

Captain Syrezeaju 21-Oct-20 10:11 PM
"That's why I'm worried," she mused, lacing her fingers together and tapping her chin. "But I think it's worth a shot. I know this goes against basically everything that the Prime Directive dictates, but we're already in deep with the entire situation. It would be wrong to back out and tell the Usaniir we can't help without even conversing with the others first. I'll have words with Starfleet Command, of course, and see what they think of the situation first."
Ensign Nikola Powell 21-Oct-20 10:11 PM
"Maybe we could convince zhem by learning about zheir religion, and finding loop holes in it." Mumbled Nikola in the background, her mind just zooming around.
4
Lieutenant Mino 21-Oct-20 10:12 PM

Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 21-Oct-20 10:14 PM

Commander T'Svai 21-Oct-20 10:16 PM
"Respectfully, sir, while this is a clear violation of the Prime Directive, it seems that these disasters are the primary factor in their lack of warp technology. Given how irregular it is for sentient life to be established on a planet with such violent tectonic activity - three species, no less - it is reasonable for us to characterize the threat and entertain the possibility that it may be an external influence." She thought aloud.

Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 21-Oct-20 10:17 PM

Captain Syrezeaju 21-Oct-20 10:18 PM

One can think about a way to prevent these disasters, i.e. melding the tectonic plates, that sort of thing. Another can look into the direct cause and see if there's anything untoward going on. It might be worth speaking to the Usaniir and seeing if they've come across anything in all of those years."
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 21-Oct-20 10:20 PM

Ensign Nikola Powell 21-Oct-20 10:21 PM

Commander T'Svai 21-Oct-20 10:22 PM

She mused. Vulcans do not scheme, but yeah, she was really trying to make an excuse here. During other eras vessels had made an effort to prevent pre-Warp civilizations from being exploited by species with warp capability and no prime directive, so it was a reasonable stance. "Do we have a probe that can withstand the heat of the volcano for any period of time? Long enough to transmit information?"

Commander T'Svai 21-Oct-20 10:30 PM

Her tone lacked any emotion whatsoever other than maybe a delicate trace of apology for even bringing it up.
Captain Syrezeaju 21-Oct-20 10:33 PM

Commander T'Svai 21-Oct-20 10:36 PM

Captain Syrezeaju 21-Oct-20 10:38 PM

If science and operations aren't using equipment that's waterproof then you need to look into replacing that, Commander," she smoothly mused in return. Commander T'Svai 21-Oct-20 10:42 PM

Spirits, she hoped that it wouldn't get in the way of their work professionally. Vulcan sarcasm verses Rigellian sarcasm, it really wasn't a good cross. Syre was going to have to learn to be more tolerant. That aside, though, at least it left her free to get on with her work. Commodore T'lunvi BOT 21-Oct-20 11:07 PM
The commodore had appeared onscreen, both hands clasped atop her desk, the background always seemed to be her office. Her face was refusing to show any emotion, it was quite odd that the next iteration of captain on board the Phoenix was contacting her so early. In fact, she figured it would be atleast a week into the assignment before Syre was requesting a transfer. How peculiar.”Captain, it is agreeable to see you again.”
6
Commodore Raffi Rios BOT 21-Oct-20 11:08 PM
On one part of the screen a Commodore appeared with a bright and childish smile she then greeted the captain."Captain Syrezeaju, how nice to see you. How is the Pheonix treating you so far? Are you getting along with the crew well?"
Captain Syrezeaju 21-Oct-20 11:13 PM
In truth she hadn't expected a response so quickly, and nor had she expected to be answered by the two Commodores who had been heading up Starfleet Sciences recently. Thankfully she managed to keep the surprise from her expression, though, instead offering a polite smile in response. Last time she had spoken to T'lunvi had to be what, during the La Salle's response when one of the Glenn-class vessels had gotten stuck while using their spore drive? And Rios... She couldn't even place it, seeing as how it had been so long ago. "Thank you, Commodores, it's a pleasure to see you both. It's been quite some time. Phoenix is marvellous, just tying up a couple of things here and there that need sorted. By any chance have you been reading our most recent logs..? I'm going to presume that's why I've had the pleasure of the heads of Starfleet Science answering my call instead of a standard operator."
Commodore T'lunvi BOT 21-Oct-20 11:19 PM
She exhaled a slow sigh as she thought about the log the captain had sent off to headquarters earlier today. “Captain, I presume the reason why you call, is because you are unsure of how to continue with the interaction of these species, is it not?”
Captain Syrezeaju 21-Oct-20 11:21 PM
The Rigellian gave an incline of her head at that, figuring that there was no point in trying to drag the conversation out unnecessarily. Might as well get straight to the point. "I'm aware that I've already broken the Prime Directive, sirs. On the one hand we're obliged to help the Usaniir, but on the other... These two other species haven't had contact with us yet either. We would be violating the Prime Directive twice more and fundamentally altering the way their society functions, potentially."
Commodore Raffi Rios BOT 21-Oct-20 11:31 PM
"Yes, that was unfortunate that the prime directive was broken though there are very few people who haven't unintentionally or intentionally broken it at some point even the likes of Picard, and Janeway. I feel as though the best way to proceed would be to help them out in any way we can. Starfleet has had some difficulties finding members willing to join us after our civil war and other recent incidents. Though we do have a duty to the prime directive try as best you can to minimize the damage to their society as best you can."
Commodore T'lunvi BOT 21-Oct-20 11:39 PM
”I concur, now that you’ve agreed to help one species it would be illogical to try and avoid helping the rest, however, try to limit the use of personnel you send to the planet. And when you conclude your interactions here, I’d expect you to move onto your next mission, you’ve already made an impression on that planet, they aren’t even warp capable. I understand why you helped with the fire. But after this mission concludes, you are to move on immediately.”
Captain Syrezeaju 21-Oct-20 11:42 PM
"Of course, sir," she said in swift agreement. "My plans at present are to speak with the other two species and gain their consent for us to stabilise their planet's tectonic plates so they no longer have to endure this devastation once every twenty years. I do fear that this might leave our crew spread rather thin to limit the number of personnel who go down there, though... We would require one group to the Mlimari, another to the Baharien, a third to look into the cause of these natural disasters, and a fourth to start creating the required technology to prevent it. And considering how we've already made contact with the Usaniir, they reached out to us, and they've been very receptive of our being here..." She was definitely trying her luck here, but trying was all she could do. "Might it be alright if more people head down there in order to research and study with their people? They have invited us, sirs."
Commodore T'lunvi BOT 22-Oct-20 12:04 AM
“If the Phoenix intends to help them, they have to learn all they can, which means more personnel, use all the crew that you need, try to assist them in any way you can captain. If we were invited, then we’ll use it to our advantage. I think I mentioned that we’d like status reports, every step of the way.”They’ve already made progress so far, why let the Phoenix withdraw?”Hopefully in 20 years, they’ll reach warp capability. And we’ll be able to really interact with them.”
Captain Syrezeaju 22-Oct-20 12:11 AM
"I appreciate your understanding, Commodore. We'll have reports sent back at every major development and I'll be certain to check in again in person if required. Again - thank you. We'll do our best to ensure that this opportunity doesn't go amiss." The word choice was a bit of a show, really, a way of trying to get on the Admiralty's good side. Syre didn't like nor dislike the lot, and they were helpful... But they could also get in the way. Despite that a last polite smile was given before she terminated the comms. "Enjoy the rest of your day, sirs. Phoenix out."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Oct-20 12:42 PM
[D]After much walking and perhaps a bit of awkward conversation, Dunamis and Khassid had finally arrived at the conference room - and the other relevant personnel called to attend the small meeting.
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 25-Oct-20 12:48 PM
[D] Amanda had woken up happy and rested, and after hearing the order to assemble in the conference room, quickly showered and changed. She walked into the conference room and gave a smile and nod to all who were there. "Commander, Commodore. Pleasure to see you. Lieutenant Commander Amanda Higgins, Chief Engineer at your service." (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 25-Oct-20 12:54 PM
Syrezeaju arrived a moment later, having been summoned down. Needless to say that she wasn't entirely happy about this mention of one away team needing to go inside a volcano and the other under the ocean, both of which were a little bit dangerous to say the last. "Afternoon, all - and Commodore, welcome aboard, and thank you for getting all of this equipment ready for us. Without any trained seismologist or volcanologist aboard we were a little bit out of our depth. I do have a question, though, if that's alright? Do we really need to send away teams into such difficult environments?"
Commodore Rejema Khassid BOT 25-Oct-20 01:00 PM
Having taken her place at the table, she inclined her head into a deep nod - seemingly apologetic for such a fact. "I am aware of the danger of such a mission, Captain, but unfortunately it is required. The cryotechnology utilised is... Volatile, in a sense. Beaming it planetside could result in it prematurely being activated. These devices must be installed by hand."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Oct-20 01:07 PM
"So as to maintain the Baharien people and to halt the movements of the planet's tectonic plates within the ocean, yes." He confirmed - grimly. "If there were a safer way of carrying out this undertaking..."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 25-Oct-20 01:13 PM
Amanda sat and listened to the Commodore explain they would need to go inside the volcano to use the technology. "That's gonna be a tough undertaking. I'm guessing the technology can withstand that level of heat, and so can our EV suits. But it's risky, way risky. I wish we were able to figure something else out, maybe with a shuttle or something."
Commodore Rejema Khassid BOT 25-Oct-20 01:17 PM
"For this first mission, a shuttlecraft can be waiting upon the surface whilst carrying the device. From there it can be guided down by divers. For its implementation within the volcano... I fear the stability of the shuttlecraft if it were to attempt the manoeuvre without guidance. We can position it above the volcano and lower it from there, but unfortunately, it will require a team to ensure its correct positioning."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 25-Oct-20 01:23 PM
"So I suppose we'll need two teams. One for the wet adventure and one for the tropical adventure. Engineering personnel on both, probably some decent climbers on the volcano team and good swimmers on the ocean team...Are we doing the missions at the same time or should we complete one and then the other?"
Commodore Rejema Khassid BOT 25-Oct-20 01:26 PM
"I would recommend one then the other due to the..." It appeared that she still had the same proclivity for forgetting a word in Standard. "...More dangerous nature of these missions. It would be wise to track one then the other - and safer, I believe."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Oct-20 01:31 PM
"Then that is what we shall do. Beginning with the diving mission."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 25-Oct-20 01:33 PM
"I'm assuming we have schematics of the technology so the engineering teams can orient themselves to them properly. I'll have volunteers ready and educated by the time we muster for the mission." Amanda tapped her chin as she thought. "If I may, what about rerouting the lava flows? Are we abandoning that mission as well or is that a go?" (edited)
Commodore Rejema Khassid BOT 25-Oct-20 01:36 PM
"Schematics are available, yes, and the detonation of these devices can be conducted from the shuttlecraft. Rerouting the lava-flow is still going to be conducted. What will be required is for a portion of the side of this volcano to be removed in order for it to create a channel for it to flow through. The cryo-device will detonate and and create a path above the lava - just above the new channel, therefore rerouting the flow through there."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Oct-20 01:41 PM
"In essence we will be required to drill through part of the side of the volcano - with the phasers of a shuttle perhaps."
Commodore Rejema Khassid BOT 25-Oct-20 01:43 PM
"That could work, with careful positioning. I must stress the importance of these missions being time-sensitive, though. The sooner they are completed the better. According to our analyses there are signs of further tectonic movement, and I would much rather have this work completed sooner rather than later."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 25-Oct-20 01:46 PM
"Definitely need to time it right. If a crew is in the volcano when the plates shift, they could be covered with lava easily. We might think to put transport enhancers on the shuttle to be able to beam a larger group back at once if something goes wrong..."
Commodore Rejema Khassid BOT 25-Oct-20 01:47 PM
"That would be a wise decision, Commander. The more precautions we take the safer the away team shall be."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Oct-20 01:54 PM
"Then we had best get to work while we can. For now, I can have an announcement put out for a team of divers to gather in the shuttlebay as soon as this conversation is over."
Captain Syrezeaju 25-Oct-20 01:55 PM
"Let's get it over and done with. The sooner they're down there and got it all sorted then the sooner they can get back up here in safety."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 25-Oct-20 01:57 PM
"Very well. I'll go on the ocean mission since I'm familiar with the technology."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Oct-20 02:01 PM
Water had never been his environment. Not once. Nonetheless he nodded. "Stay safe, Commander. How long do you think you will need to make the appropriate preparations?"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 25-Oct-20 02:08 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Oct-20 02:19 PM

Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 27-Oct-20 12:18 AM
"Okay, so, um, if I recall as accurately as I possibly can, one of the Nonbarafu said 'The Nonbarafu will reign' with regards to us asking why the evolution was so painful that they wouldn't allow anyone else to follow in their footsteps. This indicates, by my understanding, a loose grasp of immense power that they are reluctant to give up by letting them all have equal footing. They keep the other species sedated if you will so that none of them venture past their own land and 'ascend.' They must be bullying them into submission with the seismic machines, like the ones we observed at the bottom of the ocean vibrating the tectonic plates." Deimora offered as an example. "Like they all have an uncrossable chasm."
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-20 12:20 AM
"My initial thought was that these people were trying to stop the natural disasters but their machines had broken down," Syre mused. "Are we thinking that isn't the case and that they're there to create them?"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 27-Oct-20 12:20 AM
"Precisely that captain. They said they maintain the machines to make sure that they are, in fact, still running." Deimora kept her hands clasped in her lap, nervous to emote any more than she was, which wasn't a lot.
Commander T'Svai 27-Oct-20 12:23 AM
Whoops, she hadn't put that in the log, mostly because she hadn't actually been on the mission where the machine had been observed and so had seen no significance in its mention. "In that vein - I am aware this may be a question with an obvious answer, but these machines are the technology near the trench fault line referred to in your recent announcement?" She asked without much inflection.
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-20 12:27 AM
"It would be smart to presume that, I believe. There might be more down there as well holding together those fault lines. ...Dang." She stopped to rub beneath one eye. "If this is the case then it goes beyond the Prime Directive. Those Nonbarafu are natural space-dwellers interfering with lesser-evolved species, warp capable be damned. But at the same time... Getting the others to go on this journey, that 'transcendence' mentioned in your log... That would be even more interference that we can't afford."
Commander T'Svai 27-Oct-20 12:29 AM
T'Svai raised an eyebrow. "As we did not ascertain whether or not they were indeed warp capable, I therefore assume you had other contact with them?" She didn't know about the red alert either, so welcome to the department of redundancy department.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Oct-20 12:30 AM
Maggie nodded as she looked towards the captain. This was very very worrying to the tactical officer, especially if the other three species were to get caught in danger.￼
Lieutenant Xeya 27-Oct-20 12:31 AM

Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-20 12:33 AM
"An entire group of about fifty of them surrounded the ship. Didn't do anything, just stared, creepy buggers. And I agree. It seems like these planetary resets are an attempt to stop them progressing. Maybe they get to the stage that they can almost notice the geothermal energy sources and then the Nonbarafu push them back."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Oct-20 12:35 AM
Maggie nodded as she spoke right after. “Right. As it stands right now it appears to just be intimidation tactics right? Trying to scare us off of helping them. ￼￼Conflict ￼￼ with them seems inevitable should we continue with our mission, no?”
Commander T'Svai 27-Oct-20 12:36 AM
"It seemed so. This species considers themselves superior, and does not take kindly to interference with their goals in any form." T'Svai acknowledged. "At least, that was the assumption behind my... unorthodox actions towards the end of the mission."
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-20 12:37 AM
"That entirely depends on what we decide that those next steps should be, Lieutenant Verne. Halting their tectonic movement and stopping those machines is one thing. Encouraging this transcendence is another. And yes... I'm gonna want an explanation for those unorthodox actions, Commander."
Lieutenant Xeya 27-Oct-20 12:40 AM
"Captain... ultimately, shouldn't the decision on whether or not the three surface-dwelling-species 'transcend' be left to them?"
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-20 12:41 AM
"It will be, Ensign, but the decision of whether to tell them about the prospect or not? That belongs to us."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Oct-20 12:42 AM
Maggie nodded as she sat up in her chair, sipping her ￼coffee. Nervously glancing towards T’Svai.￼
Lieutenant Xeya 27-Oct-20 12:42 AM
"Indeed, sir." The ensign said, sitting back.
Commander T'Svai 27-Oct-20 12:47 AM
"My objective-" Here she unclasped and extended her left palm in an explanatory gesture- "was to demonstrate to the Nonbarafu that we were not intimidated, demonstrate our firepower non-violently, and exhibit a willingness to examine the site more closely. I also wished to determine how they would react to such sites being threatened, though I intended no harm, as it seems trivial to extinguish such areas and yet they have not done so." She paused. "That was, of course, not what happened, due to a mix of transporter timing, unexpected assistance with this gesture, and a member of the crew opting to drop a coin I could not identify into the gap in the ice, then threaten the Nonbarafu directly with a phaser." She struggled not to sound surprised by this turn of events, but managed. "I would characterize my actions as impulsive and more geared towards pure information-gathering than true diplomacy, and do not intend to take such action in the future. In short, I apologize and take full responsibility." Her tone was measured throughout, though her words were a bit more carefully enunciated than usual.
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-20 12:50 AM
"It was definitely a strange decision, Commander. Shooting beneath the feet of folk we're trying to have diplomatic talks with isn't usually a very wise thing to do, but at least it wasn't impulse and you had reason behind it. The other crew member, though... Might have to have a word with them." She sat back in her chair and crossed her arms over her chest. "I'm going to convene with our Commodore and see what she thinks about all this. We'll probably go ahead with trying to stop the natural disasters but may leave out this transcendence and have them work it out on their own. We've caused enough trouble as it is, I'd say."
Commander T'Svai 27-Oct-20 12:52 AM
"Not under their feet. Several meters away." She corrected for precision's sake. "What is strange to me is that the Nonbarafu reached this... transcendence after falling into the volcano, yet the baharien are born from and largely unaffected by that source. The probe did not return any abnormal data?"
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-20 12:54 AM
"The volcano is one of the sources of energy, correct? It might be that it goes beyond our ability to read it. Might not be geothermal at all but our scanners pick it up at such. ...Ensign Eirson did say that Admiral Ephrix mentioned 'untapped energy and potential' and uh, a metaphor about something trying to hold back a tide. What if that's the Nonbarafu holding back the evolution of the other species?"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 27-Oct-20 12:58 AM
"The keys must be in other areas. They mentioned being from the poles and venturing to the volcano, their natural opposite. What if that's the answer captain?" Deimora's eyes lit up, her head turning back to face Syre.
Commander T'Svai 27-Oct-20 12:59 AM
"It is worth noting that the Usaniir were described as being drawn to the polar region. Thus, for each species to be drawn to a region not native to it, the Baharien must migrate to the site in Mlimari territory, and the Mlimari to Usaniir territory." She guessed.
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-20 01:00 AM
"Like if you put the Baharien to the one out at sea, yes" she mused. "But again... I'll have to discuss this with someone above my pay grade. We might just have to leave them to it and let them find out themselves over the coming years."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 27-Oct-20 01:02 AM
At least they figured it out, right? Deimora nodded at the Captain's statement, her hands still clasped but on the table ever so slightly now.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Oct-20 01:03 AM
Maggie nodded as she looked at the captain. “Of course captain.”￼
Lieutenant Xeya 27-Oct-20 01:04 AM
Jaime stayed silent, but nodded at what the captain said. (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-20 01:04 AM
"Alright - I think I'll conclude this with that, then. I'll have a chat with the" backseat captaining "Commodore and probably ask for some further opinions then come to a decision. As always I'll keep you updated. If there's anything else you want to discuss about this meeting then just fire me a message, alright? Dismissed."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Oct-20 01:05 AM
Maggie stood up with a nod towards the captain, took one last sip and ￼walked back into the hallway.
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 27-Oct-20 01:05 AM
Deimora nodded once more, stood up, and left, ducking her head when she did.
Commander T'Svai 27-Oct-20 01:06 AM
T'Svai stood, straightened her uniform, turned sharply, and started out of the conference room.
Lieutenant Xeya 27-Oct-20 01:07 AM
Jaime nodded, then stood up and made their way out of the conference room.
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-20 04:44 PM
Syrezeaju had stayed down here to run administration for a little while, catching up on reports and attempting to compile them together to form something cohesive. It wasn't easy when everything you heard was second-hand. She trusted the crew to give her the correct information but it still always made more sense when you were there with them, part of the away team. On other ships she ended up ditching the rule and going on away teams with the others. Might take a while before she did that here, though. She was trying to paint a good picture and get them all on track before she let them all break some of the rules again. A little bit hypocritical... But Syrezeaju was just trying to have the place ran well. It would have been nice to gift her a mission a bit easier to begin with, though. Now she had always been the sort to appreciate a challenge but to this extent? As a first mission? Four first contacts, three violations of the Prime Directive, having to request assistance from Command, having no input from her XO, this planet being controlled by some fourth species and... Ugh, it just. It could have been easier, you know? There could have been a lot of easier things that she could have been provided with to help show that she was competent and not some sort of dangerous CO who didn't follow the rules. But - it was a bit late to change things, and so complaining wouldn't help. Syrezeaju just had to roll with the punches and see where things took her. If anything the crew had semeed to be on board with what had happened so far - hopefully, like most Starfleet crews, they would find the Prime Directive to be flexible instead of set in stone. Only time would tell. For now... She just couldn't wait for all of this nonsense to be over.
7
7
7
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-20 07:38 PM
Having heard the Usaniir's comms she quickly packed up her work and was headed back up onto the bridge in a split second.

Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 27-Nov-20 11:19 PM
Amanda exhaled and pulled out her padd. "Unfortunately not much. Other than knowing communications were cut we don't know how it was done. The shuttle was otherwise pristine both outside and in in terms of the systems. There wasn't even an organic trail on the chair, the wires used to torture the captain, or the restraints. It's almost like... No one did it. Obviously someone did, but they either are able to become non corporeal, or they can cover their tracks better than anything Starfleet can track. We had a fleeting scan of an energy signature but it dissipated before we could get anything meaningful other than it's more advanced than our technology. I wish I had more to tell sir."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Nov-20 11:27 PM

Commander Yllescas Itesh 27-Nov-20 11:50 PM
Oskar tapped one of his PADDs awake. "Well, I can tell you that the comms were cut by a self deleting block of code. I managed to save it for study, but my best decryption software is barely making any progress. As for the knife that Medical removed from the Captain, not a spec of anything that would lead us to someone. However, I did manage to get some information from Giles back on Earth. He has a copy of the code as well seeing if he can decrypt it. As for the knife..." Oskar paused, pulling on his collar a bit. "He told me it belonged to him, but he had locked it away in a museum some thirty years ago. The only other person who knew about it hasn't been seen in years. He's helping me track down the individual, an El-Aurian named Theos."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Nov-20 11:55 PM

Captain Syrezeaju 31-Dec-20 11:17 PM
The conference room might as well have been designated as the Captain's actual office at this point. It was well known by now that she found the confines of the ready room to be imposing, the continuous feeling that the four walls seemed to come closer together and closer together every single day. The conference room was far darker and the dim light was less glaringly bright. It was no wonder that she found herself more at home here than she did up there. After settling at the head of the table where the console's station was (might as well have been her own console, really,) she opened a comms link to certain members of the crew. It was about time that she got this done. [Comms] "@Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac, @Lieutenant Mino, @Lieutenant Malcolm Parsons, @Commander Yllescas Itesh, @Lieutenant Jayne Walsh,@Lt. JG. Copernicus King, @Lt. JG. Lithop Howard, @Lt. JG. T'lith, and @Planettree from Captain Syrezeaju. Could you report to the conference room on deck two, please - as soon as possible, preferably? If you can't make it then just... Send a message or something. Let me know. Out."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 31-Dec-20 11:24 PM
Oskar entered the conference room, hands at his sides as he went to one of the chairs. He stood behind it, placing his hands on the back. He gave a respectful nod to the Captain. “Sir.” He said to Syre as he sat down.

Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 31-Dec-20 11:26 PM
"Good evening, sir." he said as he crossed the threshold and found a seat near Oskar.

Ciel stepped into the conference room uncertainly. He looked around. It was not unlike the medical conference room, which put him at ease a little. Still, what was going on? "Hello, ma'am." He said to the Cap and quickly sat beside Lt. Parsons.
Lt. JG. T'lith 31-Dec-20 11:27 PM
Entering the conference room, T'lith took a quick look around. She'd only be in here once, twice now. The Vulcan found a seat beside Parlac. "Captain." She gave a tiny nod to the Captain.
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 31-Dec-20 11:27 PM
Lithop entered the conference room wondering why on earth this rather odd group was being called to a conference. "Good afternoon." She greeted to the captain, before sitting down in one of the empty seats.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 31-Dec-20 11:33 PM
Khil entered the conference room and took a seat at the table, putting down his PADD that he was currently texting on and directing his attention towards whoever was going to lead the meeting.
Captain Syrezeaju 31-Dec-20 11:39 PM
As everyone entered she did a head count before acknowledging who they actually were, akin to some sort of uninterested teacher having to lead the kids on a class outing. When she realised one was missing it was only then that she checked over who was present. Malcolm Parsons was the one that was missing. Rather understandable if he didn't want to show up at present - she was certain that their next conversation was going to be interesting to say the least. Hell, it was surprising that Amy Parsons had arrived. Syre would have understood it entirely if the woman was a no-show. "We're... Missing one, but I think we'll just go ahead," she spoke once she had finished what seemed to be scrutinising the group. To numerous in the room they likely hadn't seen her in person in over a month - and the voice did not match the one that used to speak over the comms to issue ship-wide announcements. It was now distinctly gravelly, harsh on certain consonants, and distinctly robotic. "I won't keep you here long. ...I trust that you've all enjoyed your time off, though? Sorry that it's taking so long to get us back out there. The fleet are at a little bit of a standstill with the impending news and all."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 31-Dec-20 11:43 PM
Capri cocked his head as the captain spoke, keeping an eye on the captains tone and body language as she spoke.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 31-Dec-20 11:44 PM
Parlac nodded politely, declining to actually say anything about his relatively boring time off, but wanting to acknowledge the captain's question nonetheless.
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 31-Dec-20 11:45 PM
Lithop nodded, listening to Syre talk. She wondered if the group here was gathered to talk about the Iconians, though she found it weird that she was here if it was in fact about that, she hadn't done much to help that situation. In fact the only this she had done was research, and the more she researched the more she felt impending doom. If the federation ended up going to war, she had no idea how they could win. Anyway, she kept her mouth shut and her body language respectful.
Lt. JG. T'lith 31-Dec-20 11:47 PM
T'lith did enjoy her time off. I mean getting a gift on Christmas that your parents, who disappeared when you were 18 and assumed dead, are alive and wanting to talk to you is the best thing that could happen. But she didn't respond, choosing only to give another tiny nod.
Lieutenant Mino 31-Dec-20 11:48 PM
Amy swung a nod toward the woman as well, Amy hoped the woman didn’t expect something along the lines of a verbal response. Malcolm didn’t make an appearance but that’s okay. He was resting anyways. The fact that he was alive was enough for her. But Amy couldn’t help worry about him.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 31-Dec-20 11:50 PM
Capri looked around the table again, not saying a word either. To be honest, the time off was fine but being stuck in one place was starting to make him antsy. Holidays or not, he didn't like being in the same place for so long. That was for old people.
7
Planettree 31-Dec-20 11:51 PM
Ciel simply nodded.
Captain Syrezeaju 31-Dec-20 11:54 PM
So no one felt comfortable enough to comment. It was much to her displeasure, considering how Syre did not want to do all the talking (nor was it particularly good for her) but hey, sure, okay. "I know that I haven't exactly been... Present, recently. But I've still been working away - promise." The latter was added with a joking hint; an attempt to lighten the atmosphere, perhaps. "It's made me realise that we need to ensure that people know their place in this crew - that people know who to turn to for leadership. You've all gone far too long carrying out impeccable work but not being rewarded for it. And, as such, I'd like to remedy that now."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 31-Dec-20 11:57 PM
Capri had a sudden wave of very irrational fear come over him. Oh gods, were they gonna die?
Commander Yllescas Itesh 31-Dec-20 11:57 PM
Oskar adjusted his posture and ran a hand through his hair. As far as he knew, he was just doing his job. What was she about to remedy exactly?
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 31-Dec-20 11:59 PM
He looked over at Oskar, seeing he was just as confused. Well that was a relief.....not.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 12:00 AM
Khil raised his head for a short moment, acknowledging the Captains words with a nod, it was all that he could do right now.
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 01-Jan-21 12:00 AM
Lithop’s eyes widened. Was this a promotion? No, it couldn’t be, she hadn’t done anything to deserve it. All she had done was her job, and she wasn’t even really too good at that. No, this couldn’t be a promotion. She wanted to ask questions but she didn’t know what to ask.
Captain Syrezeaju 01-Jan-21 12:00 AM
There was a pause while she again scrutinised the people before her. Then she couldn't help but lean her head against the back of her chair in complete exasperation, sighing out a rattling exhale before hauling herself to her feet. "Why do you all look so dire? You're getting promoted, yeesh."
15
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 01-Jan-21 12:02 AM
Capri couldn't help himself and suddenly burst out laughing. The tension in the room was suddenly very hilarious to him. That and he'd become so convinced Starfleet would never promote him that it had to be a joke. (edited)
Lt. JG. T'lith 01-Jan-21 12:03 AM
Promoted? T'lith's eyes widened slightly, but she quickly masked her emotions. Though she looked calm on the outside, the Vulcan was a bundle of joy and anxiety on the inside.
Planettree 01-Jan-21 12:03 AM
Ciel took a moment to look around at all the faces present. He only knew a handful of them: Lt. Parsons, obviously, and the rest were people he only knew tangentially. the Lt. most certainly deserved this. She'd been through hell and high water. But himself? He was barely two months out of the Academy! He wasn't ready to not be an ensign! He looked scared, his ears flicking back.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 01-Jan-21 12:05 AM
Parlac couldn't help himself, he grinned. This was unexpected but very welcome. He looked at the captain with an expression of pure joy: each recognition of his work within Starfleet was a reminder that he'd made the right choice, that he belonged here, that he could do this and his family's opinions be damned. His smile was broad and uncontained.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 01-Jan-21 12:07 AM
Oskar smiled slowly. Full lieutenant? He thought he’d be a junior grade for another ten years before he even thought of getting full lieutenant. He got a warm feeling in his chest. Hard work pays off.
5
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 01-Jan-21 12:08 AM
He noticed Oskar smiling as well and he leaned over to clasp him on the shoulder in a quiet show of congratulations.
6
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 01-Jan-21 12:11 AM
Capri finally stifled his laughter and looked back up at the captain, looking at the others then down to the table.
4
Captain Syrezeaju 01-Jan-21 12:11 AM
"This is something to be proud of, people, genuinely. You've all done some fantastic work and you all deserve the recognition." It was while slowly wandering around the long conference table that she spoke, handing out rank pips and switching old ones over. At Amy she paused, handing over two. "That second one is for your husband. Don't go stealing it and promoting yourself up to Commander, now. I'm watching."
14

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 01-Jan-21 12:15 AM

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 12:16 AM
Khil honestly did not know how to react. His work was usually around the jefferies tubes, nothing noticeable at least. He never thought that he would get a promotion this quickly. The man just took the pip, wide eyed and flustered with his mouth open, not saying a word. An overwhelming sense of happiness filling his mind, his dreams were coming true, one step at a time.

Commander Yllescas Itesh 01-Jan-21 12:17 AM

Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 01-Jan-21 12:18 AM
To say Lithop was in shock would be an understatement. Why was she getting a promotion. why here, why now. what had to done to deserve this achievement? "Why?" She squeaked out, still very confused.
Lt. JG. T'lith 01-Jan-21 12:19 AM
T'lith hesitantly took the box with the pip in it. She couldn't believe it, she was getting promoted. Taking the pip out of the box, she put it on her collar, right next to her other pip. The Vulcan opened her mouth, as if about to say something, before she closed it. She had no idea what to say.
Planettree 01-Jan-21 12:19 AM
Ciel held the little velvet box in his hands, looking down at it quietly. He wasn't going to put the pip on. He wasn't even going to open it. He wasn't ready.
1
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 01-Jan-21 12:19 AM
Parlac quietly affixed the new pip to his collar. Lieutenant Commander. Unbelievable. His brothers had made bets on how long he would last in Starfleet, and none of them had considered he might make it this far. He stood when Syre walked by his chair again and addressed her: "Thank you, Captain. I can't tell you how much this means to me. I intend to continue doing the best I can as your Chief of Security."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 01-Jan-21 12:23 AM
He ran his fingers over both BOTH pips now on his collar, looking back at Oskar. "I know. Its nice be a part of the club though, you know? Now I just have to catch up with you, eh?"
Captain Syrezeaju 01-Jan-21 12:24 AM
Syre shrugged, poorly concealed the grimace at the twinge of pain in the shoulder that had been dislocated, and carried on her wander around the length of the table. "Get resurrected, fast-track for a promotion. Don't tell everyone, Lieutenant Ol- Parsons, or they'll all be trying it. And you -" a gesture of the head in his direction- "don't sell yourself short, Lieutenant King. I read over your file. You're creating better accessibility programmes than Starfleet have ever attempted before. It's about time, you know?" Her gaze fell upon Lithop then, those red eyes hardly giving the glare that might be expected. Instead it was with a strange sense of tired pride that she looked at the Ensign-turned-Lieutenant. "Why? I think you ought to read over your own work. You're dedicated in a crisis, a dab hand at away missions, and I won't pretend to understand your work but according to your peers you're rather good at it. I think that warrants a promotion, don't you? So folk know they can look up to you - newcomers to the division can look to you for help?" She stopped behind her own chair again and folded her arms over the top of it as opposed to sitting down again. "And don't fret, Commander Parlac - I know you'll do well. Your efforts at bringing the Security division back from stagnation are already more than appreciated. Keep that up and I'll be more than impressed."
7
4
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 01-Jan-21 12:27 AM
Capri looked over at the Captain and nodded, a stupid grin spreading across his face again. He didn't realise the captain had read his file or was aware of his work, or would even care that much about it. He'd just figured it would be implemented and then he would remain in obscurity as the creator. "Thank you, Captain. That really means a lot to me." (edited)
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 01-Jan-21 12:28 AM
Lithop mentally reviewed her work. She had done a lot in her short time here, she just hadn't expected it to be now. She finally took out the Pip and put it on her uniform. "Thank you Captain, you're right." She smiled now, practically beaming. She and Aaron were the same rank again!
Captain Syrezeaju 01-Jan-21 12:32 AM
"You don't need to thank me, honestly. It's about time that you all got the recognition that you deserve. Now, go ahead and enjoy the rest of your day, alright? Feel free to show off to as many folk as you want, you have exclusive bragging rights for the rest of the day. Go on, now. Dismissed." Eyes, half-lidded, shifted sideways to the doctor sat at the table. "...If you could stay behind, please, Lieutenant Ciel."
Planettree 01-Jan-21 12:34 AM
Ciel started at the sound of his name, a bad tick he'd formed since the incident on the holodeck. "Of course, Ma'am."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 01-Jan-21 12:34 AM
Capri stood and looked over at Oskar, "Drinks to celebrate?"
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 01-Jan-21 12:35 AM

Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 01-Jan-21 12:37 AM
Parlac, still beaming, walked towards the exit. "Congratulations, Lieutenant," he said to Oskar as he passed, "You deserve it. Come by my office tomorrow if you could, I'd like to discuss some changes to the drills."
Planettree 01-Jan-21 12:41 AM
Ciel got up and went over to where the Cap was. This was just as well. He was going to ask if they could talk once everyone was gone anyway.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 01-Jan-21 12:42 AM
Capri was still smiling a little as he left the conference room.
Captain Syrezeaju 01-Jan-21 12:44 AM
[D] Everyone eventually filtered out.
Planettree 01-Jan-21 12:51 AM
"Umm, I-" Ciel wasn't sure how exactly to say this, "Thank you, Ma'am. Thank you very much, but... I don't- I'm not ready for this, Ma'am. I'm not ready to be... not an ensign."
Captain Syrezeaju 01-Jan-21 01:01 AM
Syre had noticed the doctor sat there looking decidedly indecisive and perhaps even frightened. Not ready, though? That hadn't been expected. She quirked her head sideways a tad. "Might I ask why you feel like you're not ready?"
Planettree 01-Jan-21 01:44 AM
“I haven’t any more experience than when I got here! I’ve only just graduated a couple months ago. Most of my knowledge is still theoretical. I was useless when it came to doing my actual job on an away team. I’m just, not ready!” Ciel said, a little more emotionally than he’d intended
8
Captain Syrezeaju 01-Jan-21 01:48 AM
And it was an emotional outburst which was met with entire calm in return - a strange reversal of their previous circumstances, it would appear. It was with the same slightly-quizzical look that Syre regarded the Lieutenant now, before speaking as softly as she could, all things considered. "Whoever said it was all about away teams, Lieutenant?"
Planettree 01-Jan-21 01:55 AM
Ciel's hands had begun to tremble slightly. He blinked, looking at her for a moment. "People died because I wasn't ready..." That seemed more important than wether or not his job was solely in the field. (edited)
3
Captain Syrezeaju 01-Jan-21 02:03 AM
There was a moment while she regarded him, and then; "c'mon. Sit down." Her own chair was dragged backwards so she could claim it again, and once she had done so she stretched across to turn the one beside it as well so they were facing - hoping Ciel would take the hint. "Tell me what happened."
5
5
Planettree 01-Jan-21 02:11 AM
Ciel sat down and placed the little velvet box on the table. He closed his eyes and tried to calm himself down. the shaking, in the meantime, had spread from his hands up to his elbows too. "It was while you were still asleep in sickbay..." He began "There was a planet where the natives, Xoids, were being systematically exterminated by an invading species. We met the invaders first, and they told us that the natives were mindless monsters who often attacked the colonists. When we met the Xoids, they were trying to defend a shielding base that the colonist forces had overrun." "Not only were the natives highly intelligent, they were using stun weapons against the invaders. They weren't even trying to kill the ones attacking the base! And the invaders were massacring them... I did my best to help the wounded. None of our people were shot, thank the Lady, but... all the Xoids that I tried to help died. There was nothing I could do." (edited)
4
4
Captain Syrezeaju 01-Jan-21 02:23 AM
Syre settled back in her chair, crossing one leg over the other. Her brow had furrowed into a frown as she listened to Ciel's recount of what had happened. "That's... Yeah. That's a difficult one, Lieutenant. It's difficult in that it was all outwith your control. We're always going to feel guilty after something like that. We feel guilty because in our eyes, it should have gone differently. It's our job to keep people safe - of course it's going to feel like some sort of personal failure when that goes wrong. It's a harsh truth, a very harsh reality, but the fact of the matter is that things don't always go the way we want them to sometimes. We might well do everything right and it still doesn't go the way that we think is correct. It's... Just one of those awful facts of life." The look she gave him was surprisingly soft, waiting for him to open his eyes again before tracking his eye movement in a way to coax him, non-verbally, into looking up. "What matters is that you tried. I'm willing to bet that you put your best effort into helping those people - and I'm sure that they would be thankful for it. You did your job. You gave them the best chance, alright? And even if you couldn't save them all - just think of how you would have looked to those people. Finally; someone there to help. A glimmer of hope 'n all."
6
6
Planettree 01-Jan-21 02:30 AM
Ciel listened quietly, trying to block out the screaming feeling that was crawling up his throat. He wanted to tell her about the way they'd turned grey under his hands, like ash. He wanted to tell her about the fact that the hybrids clearly knew what they were doing was wrong. He wanted to tell her about how the blood had been all over his suit, how it had turned the earth under his feet purple. But he didn't. He stuffed all that down. After a moment, when he had gotten the shaking to settle slightly, he looked up. "May I ask why you think I'm ready for the promotion?"
Captain Syrezeaju 01-Jan-21 02:41 AM
His silence was matched in that time between, giving Ciel as much space as he needed to reflect and consider his next steps. For someone who seemed so impatient in every other aspect it was rather surprising to see her approaching this with a completely patient attitude, ready to wait. "I've seen your work first-hand. I might not remember all of it, but it's all there in the logs. You're not some inexperienced kid straight out of the Academy - you're an experienced doctor straight out of the Academy. Our rank structure doesn't depend solely on your ability to be a Starfleet officer. It depends on your ability to do your job, to offer leadership and guidance to others. I've already seen you be the clinical lead for a team. There's not a single thing that would make me doubt your ability, Lieutenant."
5
Planettree 01-Jan-21 03:42 AM
He nodded slowly. “I suppose I’ll have to accept it even if I don’t think I’m ready?” (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 01-Jan-21 03:50 AM
"Of course not," Syre stated with a shake of her head. "You're more than allowed to decline. I'm not here to force you to do anything, alright? You know yourself better than anyone else does. You'll know what's right."
5
5

Planettree 01-Jan-21 03:55 AM
“... I think I’ll talk to Amy, if that’s alright?”
Captain Syrezeaju 01-Jan-21 04:22 AM
A small smile was given alongside a downwards incline of her head. "That's more than alright; you're welcome to consider your options. Have a think about it, alright?" There was another moment of silence in between as she quietly regarded the doctor in front of her. "And Lieutenant - or Ensign, if you decide upon that - don't let that away team mission eat away at you, alright? Talk to someone about it. You deserve better than that. Dismissed."
5
Planettree 01-Jan-21 04:31 AM
“Thank you.” Ciel gave a sad smile and got up, “And I hope you have a good night, Cap.”
Captain Syrezeaju 01-Jan-21 05:54 AM
A 'good night' seemed to be impossible given the track record of the last few days since being discharged. The sentiment was appreciated all the same, but something made her worry that the pleasantries from Ciel was just a standard front to hide how he really felt behind it. It was as such that the look she gave him was still soft and surprisingly compassionate, only hoping that he would be alright and would talk to someone if he needed to. Syre had always hated people having to wallow and wade through something alone. "And the same to you, Doctor Ciel."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 21-Jan-21 01:03 AM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 21-Jan-21 01:19 AM

6
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Jan-21 01:22 AM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 21-Jan-21 01:32 AM
Well. Now that everyone had arrived, they could move to business. Serious business. "Thank you all for coming," He said, standing. He decided not to comment on Sara's dirty hands. "How has everyone been of late?'
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 21-Jan-21 01:33 AM

Commander T'Svai 21-Jan-21 01:34 AM
"Agreeable. And yourself?" She had the feeling the question was more or less for the sake of pleasantries given there was a war and all.
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 21-Jan-21 01:35 AM
Amanda nodded to the rest of the group. "Busy, which I suppose is a good and a bad thing."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Jan-21 01:35 AM
"As well as can be expected, given the circumstances." Parlac had never been a fan of the customary small talk that preceded meetings, but it was the polite thing to do.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 21-Jan-21 01:37 AM
"Not much different from everyone else, it seems," she added curtly, the sentiment paired with the politest smile manageable. There was no use in repeating what had been established, even less so with the current state of things.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 21-Jan-21 01:40 AM
Well, if everyone was indeed busy and well, that much was good, especially in times like these. "As to the state of your departments? Morale, progress with projects and such."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 21-Jan-21 01:44 AM
Amanda kept her look and tone neutral. "Engineering is running at peak efficiency, we've managed to enhance the warp core and the safety measures in case of a core breech. Ensign Greenfield and I are close to completing our project on a high speed rescue shuttle with enhance tractor beam capabilities. As for morale? If we're speaking freely here, then everyone is scared shitless about what's to come."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 21-Jan-21 01:45 AM
Maggie looked up from her PADD. “I unfortunately have to agree with Amanda’s latter ￼assessment￼. Tactical systems are likewise ￼operating at a peak. Everyone is working hard, but this war is stressing people.” She said, knowing she was one of those people.
Commander T'Svai 21-Jan-21 01:48 AM
"The Operations department appears to have acceptable morale, given the circumstances, and is operating within the expected parameters for efficiency. We have a new officer, a systems programming specialist, who is investigating methods that can be used to limit the damage caused by the Iconian virus by isolating key systems. Our quartermaster is at work ensuring the ship, particularly Medical, has the resources they'd need in the event of a large-scale emergency. Other department operations are proceeding as normal. There was a department-wide meeting on Stardate 154991.24 in which several suggestions were made, which I have written into the log from that meeting." T'Svai listed, hands clasped on the table. "Perhaps a reminder that the ship's counselors are an underused resource would not go unappreciated." She added. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Jan-21 01:52 AM
"Morale in security is surprisingly high, all things considered, but unfortunately I expect that things will only go downhill from here. The upcoming mission, which we don't exactly have a concrete timeline for, has taken up most of my time-- comparing files, going over the dossier, so on and so forth. I intend to take a team of three security personnel with me." He looked up from his PADD at the rest of the room, the bags under his eyes more obvious than he would have liked. Clearly, this wasn't just taking up most of his time-- it was consuming his energy as well.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 21-Jan-21 01:55 AM
"Sickbay storage facilities are almost at full capacity, and that's accountin' for emergency supplies and triage inventory. In regards to the latter, as Commander T'Svai has mentioned, the appropriate checks are underway out to ensure that we're still able to accommodate injured crew should deck six become overwhelmed or inoperable at any point. As for morale, officers are still occupyin' themselves with personal projects and the likes, one in particular that may be of benefit to the upcomin' security effort to apprehend Noi," the latter was directed more towards Parlac, whose wearied appearance earned a gentle frown from Blanche.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Jan-21 01:56 AM
Parlac offered a weak smile to Blanche and nodded, making a note on his PADD. "I wouldn't want to hijack the meeting, so I can discuss that with you after if you like, but I'm interested to see what you have in mind."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 21-Jan-21 01:57 AM
"Oh? Do elaborate. A project of what nature?"
Commander Blanche Carlisle 21-Jan-21 02:02 AM
A brief glance was spared down towards her own PADD, rested neatly atop the table. "Lieutenant Ciel is lookin' at a fungus typically utilised for recreational purposes. He's hopin' to concentrate its effects to be specific to pain receptors, so that it's able to be administered as an alternative to conventional pain-killers. What with Noi's . . abilities, myself and Nurse Parsons thought that should the trials be successful, it might become an option for the away team in protectin' themselves where typical methods might be rendered ineffective." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Jan-21 02:08 AM
That warranted a reaction, and Parlac's brows rose in unison, a mixture of shock and thoughtfulness evident on his face. "That... Well, that would be incredibly useful. I was just preparing myself to try and work through mind numbing pain, but-- I mean, there are drawbacks, we won't notice if we're cut or bleeding, for example, but... I think we can watch out for each other, make sure nothing gets overlooked. Quite an impressive project. Given the progress Intel is making, I hope Lieutenant Ciel is able to make quick work of this fungus-- I don't mind being a test subject for it, but I'll clear it with any security volunteers as well before we leave." He paused, considering, then: "Hm, there is... I'd prefer to have him with us, if you'd allow me? I know it's risky, but I'd find it ill-advised to try and self-administer, especially with no medical staff aboard. Do you think he'd be up for it? Entirely voluntary, of course."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Jan-21 02:12 AM
"Morale in science is.. low. We have an unprecedented amount of depressed officers and I genuinely don't know why. Several of my officers are plagued with feeling useless, even though they are incredibly useful and continue to perform well on bridge exams, away missions and general day-to-day functions. No other department seems to have this phenomenon." Sara blurted out, almost ashamed that she was having to say it. She really, genuinely couldn't explain why this was happening.
7
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 21-Jan-21 02:16 AM
Maggie took in a ￼moment to listen to what the others said. They were going after Noi, and Parlac was leading a security team to go after him. Maggie wrote that down, before giving a ￼ reassuring look to Sara.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 21-Jan-21 02:16 AM
The idea of painkilling fungus seemed... alright, if somewhat questionable to him. Especially the part where Parlac volunteered to test it on himself. Sara's statement, however, made his expression stiffen. That was not good, in any circumstances. Especially not in these circumstances. "Lieutenant Bjorge, have you talked to them about the same and asked why they feel that way?"
Commander Blanche Carlisle 21-Jan-21 02:16 AM
"You're certainly welcome to propose the idea to him," Blanche's expression softened, recalling the officer's enthusiasm. "Of course, I'm sure we'll be able to discuss everythin' in further depth afterwards. With the Lieutenant present, preferably; I'm sure he'd be delighted to give you a more thorough walk-through of the potential outcome—." She paused, then, allowing for Sara to speak. (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Jan-21 02:19 AM
"I have, and it seems to be the same answer put into different sentences in different ways. My science girls specifically seem to be having.. I dunno. Imposter syndrome or something. They feel useless and depressed, they feel there is not enough work, and when there is work, they feel they have not done a good job.. even though they most certainly have. I've gotten counselors involved, but I still haven't seen much improvement. I don't think a pizza party can quite save this, I need more intervention."
Commander T'Svai 21-Jan-21 02:24 AM
T'Svai contemplated Sara's words for a few moments before nodding sympathetically. "Your department's work is more highly specialized than any other's." She began thoughtfully. "Therefore, any individual is unlikely to collaborate with any other individual, and the impact of their work isn't always well understood by the others around them. It is possible that each of them is attempting to compare themselves to experts in entirely different areas, and that in combination with the new declaration of war makes it feel as if their skill set is not practical. Therefore, to aid in resolving that issue and the issue of there being a perception of not enough work, I suggest encouraging members of your department to shadow members of other departments, and perhaps present research to their colleagues." She suggested in a very impersonal Vulcan sort of way.
3
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 21-Jan-21 02:26 AM
Maggie sighed softly as she looked at her best friend on the ship, her stress getting up there with the talk of the upcoming war and just everything that they were going over. Before looking over to T’Svai. “Right. If you want to have them shadow me or another member of tactical I can work that out.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Jan-21 02:27 AM
Sara listened attentively to T'Svai, nodding along a bit at a time. She'd done something similar with Lithop in the beginning, and it certainly had worked well.. "That is an amazing suggestion Commander T'Svai, I will begin plans for that immediately with the Captain and XO's approval." (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 21-Jan-21 02:34 AM
"I'd like to speak with them myself if possible, actually. Perhaps we could use the shadowing as an additional plan. Draw up a proposal for now if you feel the need, lieutenant." He remarked. "But for now, I'm afraid we must move on. As to the idea of the fungus... I'd like to consider the idea for now and revert back to you both on it. How long before we can expect some results?" (edited)
Commander Blanche Carlisle 21-Jan-21 02:48 AM
"As was mentioned, we'll be sure to discuss the proposal in greater depth once the meetin' is over. This is the Lieutenant's research, not my own. While I'm confident he'll be able to work successfully within whatever time we have, it'd be unfair of me to make promises on his behalf. I'm afraid developments like these don't occur overnight, and unnecessary pressure is unlikely to speed things up." (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 21-Jan-21 02:55 AM
"I understand, Commander, thank you." He nodded, "Now. Lieutenant Verne. Progress as to the shipwide training I requested? Are there any further updates that you all wish to raise?" (edited)
Commander Blanche Carlisle 21-Jan-21 03:17 AM
“Actually, one more thing.” Blanche perked up from her PADD again, disinclined to remain silent and have the thought leave her head. “The Captain is currently in Sickbay undergoin’ some final tests. She ought to be cleared for duty by the end of the day.”

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 21-Jan-21 03:08 PM
"Excellent. I will notify you both in due course. Lieutenant Bjorge - as to the report on Iconian culture I asked for?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Jan-21 03:55 PM
Sara, who'd been listening intently, suddenly jumped a bit as she heard her name. Damn it, that was her. "Yes sir. Ensign Briar was able to send me over what she was able to find out culturally- They have three servitor species that they own..so it's not just the Iconians themselves we will be fighting. The names of the species are the Heralds, the Elachi, and the Solanae. The Heralds are semi-sentient and are regarded like children or pets to them. After the destruction of the Iconians homeworld, they were modified into bodyguards. The Iconians still seemingly very much care about them though. The Elachi are beings of the Mycelial network and are the warriors of the Iconians though they very much prefer to use drones and other more distant warfare rather then directly sending them in. The Solanae are their scientists." She unfolded and refolded her hands before starting again. "And from what I've been able to find on their military history- The Iconians' military force is made up of those same Herald servants who operate their starships and fight their enemies on the ground. They have six different types of ships that have been observed, but these may not be the same types of ships they have in service now. But for all of this, The Iconians themselves don't seem to fight much of their own battles for the exception of being behind the proverbial curtain." (edited)

Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 21-Jan-21 04:04 PM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Jan-21 04:10 PM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 21-Jan-21 04:26 PM
Maggie nodded as she pulled up her notes, sighing as she read them over. “I mean. I don’t think we’ll be able to come up with any surefire theories. But tactical has a few projects underway. I am currently working on upgrading our targeting to better target their ships. We are also developing gravimetric charges to be deployed within torpedoes. Hydrogen to interfere with antiproton beams. As well as using smaller craft to bombard them from their weak spots, such as the ￼USS Chimera. Additionally, we have a member of the department who remembers the last war.”￼

Commander T'Svai 21-Jan-21 04:30 PM
"I wonder if MCPO D'Patkatol recalls anything of interest." T'Svai mused idly. She had the impression that if she asked he'd start worrying if some unspecified element of his past was coming back to haunt him, but it was a good avenue to explore.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 21-Jan-21 04:44 PM
Nedras. The Vorta. Of course. Each clone retained the knowledge of its previous 'version', for lack of a better term. He might just have insights that could make all their lives significantly easier. "Could you get him to help you with your training program? If he is willing of course. As for chief D'Patkatol..." He fell silent, tapping his fingers on the tabletop. "At this juncture I would appreciate any information we can acquire. Perhaps it would be wroth speaking to him about what he remembers." (edited)
Commander T'Svai 21-Jan-21 04:44 PM
T'Svai added speaking with D'Patkatol to her meeting notes.
